description: Twice weekly Arsenal podcast covering the latest news, performances, tactics and more with thoughtfulness and a bit of humor.

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss Declan Rice. The pod starts with the latest on Rice and asks the question of how good he really is and how he fits in at Arsenal. Then there’s a bit of a rumor roundup including Caicedo, Havertz , Cancelo and Jorginho news. There’s a bit on Messi to MLS and the moves being made by Saudi Arabia as well. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss all the latest news and look back on last summer's predictions. The topics include the new Spurs manager, the FA Cup, handball and penalty rules, referee treatment, and plenty on transfers including the scenarios at Brighton that may impact the situation at Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Jame Benge of CBS Sports (@jamesbenge). The pod covers a wide range of rumors and critical issues facing the club heading into the summer starting with William Saliba’s contract. There’s a discussion of the Declan Rice links, Mount’s move to United, and Emile Smith Rowe’s future as well. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Live From Union Chapel - Featuring Ian Wright

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillmanator) to relive the best moments of an amazing weekend including the Union Chapel event on Saturday and the game on Sunday. There’s discussions of what actually happened in the match of course, a bit on the lap of appreciation, plenty on Xhaka and some season summary thoughts. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss lots of different topics including the new kit, the final weekend of the season and the ramifications at both ends of the table. There’s a big chat about Saka and Nelson signing new deals and what still needs to be done. Then some of Mikel’s more interesting comments are discussed. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the way we’ve finished the season in the wake of another loss, this time at Nottingham Forest. There’s some effort to understand and contextualize the run-in before the pod gives way to the usual instant reaction format of talking headlines, stock rising and stock falling from the game. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 688 - Questions Left To Answer

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the early start to transfer-rumor season. But first they do a little bit on the CL semifinals and Manchester City’s demolition of Real Madrid. Then the rumors covered include Xhaka’s departure, Cancelo to Arsenal, Rice and Caicedo, Saliba’s contract, Ramsdale signing, NFFC preview and a few other bits and pieces. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 687 - How To Catch City

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (Stillmanator) first and Clive (@clivepafc) next (59’). Tim and Elliot cover the feeling of let down from a heavy defeat at home to Brighton before unpacking what happened on the pitch and why. Then Clive comes on to think a bit about what we missed on Sunday and look at the bigger picture. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 686 - Pin In The Balloon

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to cover the latest news from the manager’s press conference and look ahead to Brighton. The pod starts with a discussion of Zinchenko’s injury and his importance to the team this season as well as what Arsenal will do in his absence. Then there’s a quick chat about the Champions League and the quality of the game between City and Madrid. There’s some rumor talk focused on Xhaka and Declan Rice before there’s a preview of Brighton’s visit to the Emirates on Sunday. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 685 - Players Going and Coming

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a phenomenal win at a raucous St. James’s Park. Their conversation covers the lineup, early pressure, composure and control, Odegaard stepping up, Jorginho and Kiwior’s contributions, and all the big moments from the game. There’s a bit on what it means for the season and the future as well as the feeling of pride associated with the performance. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.content:

items.title: Episode 682 - Mailbag - Where Do We Go From Here

items.content:
Arsenal’s disappointing defeat at the Etihad. The pod starts with the emotions in the wake of the defeat before moving into the reasons for the chasm between the teams on the pitch. There are questions about certain individual performances and why Arsenal couldn’t handle City’s straightforward tactics. There’s also a discussion about where the season goes from here and what that means for the future. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 680 - NBC's Rebecca Lowe on City Versus Arsenal

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypats) to discuss a very unexpected and disappointing result at home to Southampton. The pod starts with a discussion of the lineup, the early errors, some questionable performances and what’s changed defensively. There’s a discussion about whether the pressure is getting to the team and how they handle that. Then the discussion moves on the the subs, the fightback at the end and some individual questions. There's a tiny bit of Schadenfreude, and finally, there’s a look ahead to the City game and what is on the line. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 679 - Moment of Truth

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to cover Mikel’s pre-match comments and preview the Southampton game. After that, Adrian Clarke from the Breakdown Live joins the pod to discuss why Arsenal have dropped points from winning positions, how we compensate without Saliba and Tierney, how to better use our subs, and whether Declan Rice is the next logical piece of the puzzle. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 678 - Space Animal

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@Stillmanator) while Clive flies home to London and Paul recovers from a busy weekend. The pod covers a very disappointing draw to West Ham and looks ahead to the rest of the title challenge. The conversation starts with some praise for the goals and then shifts to what went wrong, including some links to the game at Anfield. Specific tactical issues and player performances are discussed along with the subs that were made and not made. Finally, there’s a question of where this leaves Arsenal in the title race. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 677 - ’89 All Over Again?

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by legendary Arsenal defender Lee Dixon to discuss Arsenal’s title challenge and more. It’s a fascinating conversation that covers topics including handling pressure, Arsenal’s incredible rebuild and return to its roots, and the new back four. After the break, Elliot is joined by Tim (@stillmanator) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to preview the West Ham game. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Support the fundraiser at https://www.justgiving.com/page/arsenalvision

items.title: Episode 676 - Lee Dixon on Pressure and Panic

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a thrilling and emotionally challenging game at Anfield where the points were shared. The pod starts with a tactical overview of the game before covering all the big moments. The changes in momentum are analyzed along with the key performances. There’s a big question about whether it was a good point or not and what it means for the run in. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 675 - Good Point Bad Point

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) opens the pod then Tim (@stillmanator) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss @⁨Elliot Smith⁩ recorded! The challenge of Liverpool away. The pod crew asks how much the team and coaches consider the psychological angle of the game. Then they wonder why Klopp heavily rotated against Chelsea ahead of this game. There are also thoughts on Holding and Zinchenko versus Salah, how Arsenal should line up in attack and the importance of Gabriel Jesus. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 674 - Anfield Away

items.content:
In part two of this two part series, Elliot speaks to the Arsenal people responsible for designing and delivering the Coaching for Life program to the refugees in the Za’atari camp in Jordan. They tell their story of how the program ties back to the work being done in North London, why the need is so great in the Za’atari camp, and how the program is making a difference. All the interviews were conducted in the camp during a trip to Jordan in March.
If you'd like to contribute to the fundraiser, you can do so at the links below. Everyone who donates to our fundraiser has a chance to win VIP box tickets to the Brighton game!

Support the fundraiser at https://www.justgiving.com/page/arsenalvision

items.title: Stronger Together Part 2

items.content:
In part one of this two part series, Elliot shares his experiences from inside the Za'atari refugee camp. In this episode you will hear from the refugees themselves. They describe in their own words, what Arsenal means to them, and the impact the Coaching For Life program has had on their lives. You will also meet the Syrians and Jordanians working inside the camp to help administer the program and ensure that it carries on. Tomorrow, in part two, you will meet the Arsenal people who have been instrumental in designing and delivering the program, and how it relates to the work being done in North London.
If you'd like to contribute to the fundraiser, you can do so at the links below. Everyone who donates to our fundraiser has a chance to win VIP box tickets to the Brighton game!

items.title: Stronger Together Part 1

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s big win over Leeds. The podcast starts with an appeal to help us support the Arsenal Foundation’s work in the Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan. Everyone who donates has a chance to win VIP box tickets to the Brighton game! There’s a short clip of audio from the refugee children expressing what the program and the Club means to them. After that, the podcast trio discusses the lineup, the performances, the key moments from the game and the impending trip to Anfield. There’s also a bit on manager sackings. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Support the fundraiser at https://www.justgiving.com/page/arsenalvision

items.title: Episode 672 - Are You Ready For It

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillmanator) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to engage in a very international break kind of podcast. It opens with Arsenal women demolishing Spurs and their upcoming Champions League second leg fixture home to Bayern Munich. Then there’s some speculation about the managerial merry-go-round potentially kicked off by Julian Nagelsmann being sacked by Bayern. There’s some interlull usage and injury worries as usual. Then there’s a discussion about the role ESR might play this season and beyond, as well as the future of Folarin Balogun. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a big win over Crystal Palace that moves Arsenal eight points clear of Manchester City with ten games to play. The lineup is discussed as well as some of the key performances including Rob Holding who filled in capably for William Saliba. All the goals and moments are analyzed before attention turns to the run-in and Antonio Conte slamming Tottenham. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a disappointing exit from the Europa League and what it might mean for Arsenal’s season. There’s a conversation about the lineup the manager picked and the injuries Arsenal suffered, as well as the impact of Jesus who got his first start since his injury. Some poor performances are analyzed before attention turns to the manner of the defeat and what it might mean for Arsenal’s season in light of the European draws. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 668 - Goodbye Forever

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a brilliant performance at Craven Cottage. The pod starts with the pre-match news of Trossard starting and Jesus making the bench. Then there’s a breakdown of all the beautiful football Arsenal played, the individual performances that sparkled and specifically how Jesus looked on his return. Finally there’s a look ahead to Thursday and beyond. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 666 - Stretched Thin

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a weekend of football that we will all remember forever. The pod starts with the raw emotion of the moment, the memories of the weekend and how it was experienced around the world including covering all the best bits of video that came out of the chaos. After a long discussion of the craziness there’s a bit on Reiss Nelson and then the pod shifts into covering the game tactically and in terms of the individual performances plus the VAR decisions. At the end there’s still time to laugh at United. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 665 - Only Football Can Do That

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s slow start and ultimately dominant performance in the win over Everton at the Emirates. The pod starts with the early patterns of the game and the role played by the center backs in ensuring that Arsenal stayed on level terms. Then there’s a conversation about Zinchenko’s role, the opening two goals, and the continued brilliance of Bukayo Saka. There’s a breakdown of the difference between the two halves as viewed through the lens of the performances of Jorginho and Thomas Partey. Finally all the fun moments and goals are broken down, before discussing the subs and looking ahead to Bournemouth. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 664 - Statement of Intent

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Tim (@stillmanator) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s crunch win at Leicester. Then a discussion of Trossard playing 9, Jorginho’s performance, Xhaka’s potential attacking redundancy as well as the disallowed goal, and VAR. There’s also a debate about whether Leicester were just awful or Arsenal were truly too dominant for them to handle. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a range of topics in a relatively quiet week. The pod opens with questions about how good City actually are, and what we need to do to keep them in the rear view mirror. Then there’s a discussion about how Saka refereed and how to protect him. Finally there’s a look at players who have big roles to play in the run-in, including Vieira, ESR and Gabriel Jesus. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 662 - Here Come The Reinforcements

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a euphoric victory at Villa Park that left Arsenal clear at the top of the table after City dropped points to Forest. The pod starts with a long conversation about the scenes of joy and celebration, the impact of the win and the emotional shift within the club. The trio breaks down all the little fun moments at the end of the game and revels in each one of them. Then there’s a serious discussion of the tactical aspects of the game including the challenges in the first half and what changed in the second half that turned it all around. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 661 - From Collapse to Climax

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a heartbreaking loss at home to Manchester City. The pod opens with a general discussion of the emotions of the moment and whether it feels like we’re at a turning point in the title challenge. Then there’s a detailed examination of the tactical battle, the way Arsenal rose to the challenge in the first half and shrunk from it in the second half. The missed moments and mistakes are discussed before the pod wraps up with a look ahead to what’s left of the season. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 660 - Devoured By The Moment

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a diabolical weekend of refereeing including the wrongfully allowed Brentford goal that cost Arsenal 2 points. There’s a full review of the performance including the question of whether there’s a defensive approach that is proving difficult for Arsenal to overcome. There’s an assessment of some individual performances as well. Lastly there’s a bit of preparation for City on Wednesday. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

The new owners angling to buy United are also discussed as is United’s home draw to Leeds. There’s injury news ahead of Brentford’s visit to the Emirates and a preview of that game. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 658 - The End of Manchester City

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss how City’s loss to Tottenham changes the narrative back to general positivity after a rough day at Goodison Park on Saturday. The pod starts with some stuff on the City game before turning full attention to the loss at Everton. There are questions about performance, tactics, subs and whether changes may be required in the near future. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 657 - The Agony and The Ecstasy

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Tim (@stillmanator) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the close of the window, the moves that were made and how we judged Edu and the Arsenal executive team. There’s a decision about the ill-fated Caicedo deal and a potential summer move for Declan rice, as well as the situation with Folarin Balogun who is tearing it up in France. There’s a look ahead to Everton and questions about whether Jorginho might start. After the break Dan Dormer from the London is Blue podcast joins the pod to give the Chelsea perspective on Jorginho. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 656 - Much Edu About Nothing

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the Caicedo transfer news and the FA Cup exit at the Etihad. The pod starts with a full discussion of Caicedo’s efforts to get his move, Brighton’s reaction to it, and whether the player is the right man at the right price at the right moment for Arsenal. The second half of the pod covers the FA Cup tie. There’s discussion of the lineup, the tactical chess match, what Arsenal may have gained from the game, and a breakdown of the individual performances. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Follow us on TikTok @arsenalvpodcast
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 655 - Caicedo Pushes For His Move

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss how to approach the upcoming cup competitions with a specific focus on the Manchester City game being played Friday. There’s a discussion about the importance of a “winning culture,” the value of keeping a little something in reserve for City when the teams face each other in the league in the coming weeks, and a more specific conversation about players who might come into the team for the cups. There’s a conversation about the point total required to win the league based on a look back. Lastly there’s a roundup of the transfer rumors and what Arsenal need to do specifically in midfield. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 654 - Do The Cups Matter

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillmanator) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to luxuriate in a massive win over United. The pod starts with the emotions of the moment and just how much it all means. Then the big moments are broken down with praise being dished out to so many players who played an important role in the win. There’s love for the Hale End boys and of course for the magnificent Zinchenko as well as some thoughts on Trossard’s cameo. There’s some tactical breakdowns, some data on the Arsenal dominance and some schadenfreude as well. Lastly there’s a bit of a discussion about where this leaves the title challenge. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillmanator) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s demolition of Spurs at their stadium. The conversation covers the team performance, the gulf in class, the individuals who stood out, the changes late in the game, and what the club needs to do to ensure this season becomes one to remember forever. Plus plenty of laughing at Tottenham. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 649 - The One With Martin Odegaard

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss transfer news first, then the win over Oxford. In the first section, there’s a discussion of Felix’s impending move to Chelsea and Mudryk seemingly close to joining Arsenal. Then the discussion turns to the cup tie with a focus on performances from Eddie, Vieira, Sambi and Smith Rowe’s return. There’s a discussion about rotation, squad depth generally, and then a look ahead to the City tie and the NLD. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 648 - Mudryk Close as Arsenal Earn City Tie

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a frustrating draw to Newcastle and some transfer thoughts. The discussion about the game covers the opening period where Arsenal dominated, the approach NUFC took to the game, the big referee decisions, lack of subs, touchline antics and quite a bit more. Then there’s some questions about strengthening the squad. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 647 - 53 Scoreless Minutes

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss how Arsenal started fast against Brighton to win again. There’s a discussion of the early phase of the game and the Arsenal goals, the way we adjusted the game plan against a team that kept the ball well, and how the subs destabilized the team. There’s plenty of discussion of the other results around the league, as well as look ahead to Newcastle on Tuesday. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 645 - A Monumental January

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss Arsenal’s win over West Ham on the night of Arsene’s return to the emirates. The pod opens with a quick discussion of the atmosphere at the Emirates and the return of Arsene Wenger. Then the conversation moves on to the dominant football Arsenal played in the first half, the chalked off goal, the penalty, and the little extra bit that was missing. Odegaard and Saka come in for huge praise, and of course, there’s a long section on Eddie’s performance and his well taken goal. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 644 - Arsenal Welcomes Arsene Back In Style

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Mikel’s interview with Jamie Carragher, the latest squad news, and the impending West Ham game. The first half of the pod covers all the interesting revelations and insights from Mikel’s candid and wide ranging interview on Sky Sports. Then there’s discussion of Martinelli’s rumored contract, Smith Rowe’s injury update, and a look ahead to the West Ham game. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 642 - Arsenal’s Title Challenge Beckons

items.content:
On this edition of World Cup Daily, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Phil Costa (@_philcosta) to discuss Messi becoming a World Cup winner after outlasting Mbappe's France in an epic World Cup final for the ages. On this edition of World Cup Daily, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Phill Costa (@_philcosta) and Lewis Ambrose (@LGambrose) to discuss Messi leading Argentina into the final. The big moments are analyzed along with the big performances. There are questions about Croatia failing to make the game close as well as a look back on how Argentina have played throughout the tournament and whether they’ll win it all. Finally there’s a brief look to the other semifinal and a shock at the very end of the pod. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision World Cup Daily.

items.title: Episode 641 - Arsenal Reassembles

items.content:
On this edition of World Cup Daily, Tim (@stillmanator) is joined by Phill Costa (@_philcosta) and Lewis Ambrose (@LGambrose) to discuss France beating England and Morocco beating Portugal but first there’s a moment to reflect on the tragic passing of American football journalist Grant Wahl. After that, the attention turns to England crashing out despite a great Saka performance thanks to a miss from Kane and a goal from Giroud. There’s a bit of chat about the Arsenal implications, the substitutions, and more. Then there’s Morocco deservedly becoming the first African team to advance to a World Cup semifinal by beating Portugal and leaving Ronaldo in tears. Finally there’s a brief look to the semifinals. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision World Cup Daily.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
On this edition of World Cup Daily, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Phill Costa (@_philcosta) and Lewis Ambrose (@LGambrose) to discuss Argentina surviving the Netherlands in a penalty shoot-out after after an unlikely dutch comeback. Then there’s Croatia’s unlikely penalty shootout victory over Brazil that sees Gabriel Martinelli heading back to Arsenal. Then there’s a look ahead to the second set of Quarterfinals. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision World Cup Daily.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.content:
On this edition of World Cup Daily, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) to spend a majority of the episode breaking down the USA-England game. There’s a discussion about the impressive display from the USA and why England looked so subdued. There’s focus on the midfield and some impressive individual performances before there’s a look ahead to the final matches in the group. Then there’s coverage of the other games today along with a look ahead to tomorrow. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision World Cup Daily.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
On this edition of World Cup Daily, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Phil Costa (@_philcosta) and Lewis Ambrose (@lgambrose) to recap a really fun day of football including Germany’s struggles, Spain’s dominance and the disappointing loss for an excellent Canada. There’s also a look ahead to the next day of games. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision World Cup Daily.

items.title: World Cup Daily - England Run Riot

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the Edu being named the club’s first ever Sporting Director, what that means for his role and any changes that could come about as a result of the move. There’s a discussion of Saka’s performance for England a long with a bit of World Cup chat. Lastly there’s a bit of transfer speculation. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: World Cup Daily - Tournament Preview

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss the performance at Wolves including individual moments that stood out and players who made the difference. Then there’s a conversation about City losing to Brentford, how the title race is shaping up, and how the World Cup will impact the league. There’s also a discussion about what needs to be done in the January window. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 636 - Top At Christmas

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a loss to Brighton in the League Cup and whether it’s for the best, before there’s a look ahead to Wolves and the World Cup. Tim was at the game and so he’s the rare person who can give a clear account of what happened. After that, the conversation turns to World Cup squads and the challenge of remaining focused for one more game before the league hits pause. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 635 - Stay Focused

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a dominant 1-0 victory over Chelsea at Stamford Bridge. The pod covers Arteta’s superiority over Potter tactically, the total control but missed opportunities, the stunning individual displays (notably Saliba) and the fun little moments throughout the occasion. Then there’s some time to enjoy the rest of the weekend around the League. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

itunes.author: ArsenalVision Podcast LLC
itunes.subtitle: Domination, tactical superiority, individual brilliance, fun moments, and a great PL weekend.
itunes.summary:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillmanator) to discuss a dominant 1-0 victory over Chelsea at Stamford Bridge. The pod covers Arteta’s superiority over Potter tactically, the total control but missed opportunities, the stunning individual displays (notably Saliba) and the fun little moments throughout the occasion. Then there’s some time to enjoy the rest of the weekend around the League. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 634 - It’s Effing Unbelievable

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a win over Zurich and preview the trip to Stamford Bridge. The first part of the pod discusses an ugly win over Zurich with a focus on Tierney’s solid performance and evaluating the squad players. The second part of the pod looks ahead to the Chelsea match on Sunday and what to expect from Arsenal’s first big away test since Old Trafford. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 632 - Reisset

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a disappointing loss to PSV that leaves Arsenal needing to win at home to Zurich to secure top spot in their Europa League group. The groups debates whether there’s cause for concern based on recent performances. There’s analysis of what isn’t working at the moment before individual performances are analyzed. Lastly there’s a look ahead to Forest at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 631 - Should We Worry

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a contentious draw at St. Mary’s. The conversation covers a key lineup decision, the early dominance, wasted chances and what to make of the profligacy. There’s a discussion of the decisions that went against Arsenal and the refereeing in general. Then attention turns to a poor second half performance and whether there’s cause for concern. There’s some focus on a few individual performances including the subs, and a bit on the situation in the league generally. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the week of football and how it continued to be good for Arsenal. items.title: Episode 629 - Everything’s Coming Up Arsenal

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a masterclass in winning ugly. The pod covers the long delay to start the game, the early positive signs and how they gave way to a massive struggle as the game wore on. The huge moments are covered, as well as the players who seemed to be off their best. There’s praise for the players who were key to keeping the points as well. The group discusses why Arsenal looked so poor, especially in the second half and tries to answer whether it’s actually good to “win ugly.” Lastly there’s a bit on City losing. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:

items.title: Episode 626 - Now You're Gonna Believe Us

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) to review the Boda Glimt performance and look ahead to Liverpool. Most of the Europa League conversation focuses on individual performances and questions about rotation as a brutal run of fixtures begins. Then the group looks ahead to Liverpool and a fascinating battle of two teams that want to do a lot of the same things tactically. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 625 - Our Toughest Test Yet

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to revel in a wonderful derby day. There's a discussion of the day out, the lineup, the dominance of Arsenal's football, individual brilliance, and how Mikel out-coached Conte. Plus a look ahead to Liverpool. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 624 - We Proved It

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the impending North London Derby and all the ramifications that go with it. There’s a discussion about injury concerns and who might be available and selected before the conversation turns to tactics. Then there’s a long debate about what’s reasonable to expect this season and how that hinges on the next two league fixtures. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 623 - Prove It

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss injury updates, the impact of the international break on Arsenal and Spurs, the fixture congestion ahead and which players are in line to distinguish themselves during the brutal fixture congestion ahead. Lastly there’s a discussion about what we need to accomplish in October and how the table might start to spread out. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 622 - The Squad Will Be Tested

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Tim (@stillberto) to look ahead to the Derby and asses the actual qualities and weaknesses of Tottenham. The conversation starts with some playful speculation about Conte leaving for Juve. After the Derby talk there’s a bit of a look at Liverpool and comparing what they built and the possible end of their project with what Arsenal are doing now. Lastly there’s talk about changing expectations for success in the Premier League. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 621 - What Do We Think Of Tottenham

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Clive (@clivepafc) and Phil Costa (@_philcosta) to discuss another fantastic performance from Arsenal, this time at Brentford. The conversation starts with comments on the lineup and injury absences. Then there’s a discussion of the degree of control from Arsenal, the tactical tweaks and the squad building decisions that have made this possible. There’s plenty on the goals, and the start performances along with the debut for a 15 year old. Lastly there’s a bit of a mention of the derby. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 620 - This Is Not A Mirage

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by James Benge (@jamesbenge) to talk Todd Boehly and the situation at Chelsea. They also discuss Haaland and Manchester City, Nunez and Liverpool, and whether Spurs are good. Then Elliot is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the return of Arsenal, the impact of the layoff, the game ahead this weekend, and the fixtures ahead. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 619 - All-Star Football Is Back

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to answer listener questions on a wide range of topics including: players fighting for a World Cup place, ESR’s role this season, the fixture pile up following postponements, moves to be made in January, and comparing our young talent. items.title: Episode 618 - September Mailbag

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s season being paused after the passing of the Queen and all the ramifications of that decision. After that there’s a detailed discussion of the win over Zurich in the Europa League, with a nice full debut for Marquinhos. A few additional notable performances are dissected as well as a few issues that might need to be addressed. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 617 - Arsenal’s Toughest Opposition

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s much improved but somewhat familiar loss at Old Trafford. The episode starts with a discussion about VAR overturning a brilliant Martinelli goal and the impact on the game. There’s a section on the dominance that followed from Arsenal and the way Arsenal were able to control the game and push United back. There’s a big section on the issues that lead to the goals, specifically in midfield and more specifically the performance of Sambi Lokonga. Then the group discusses the subs, the way the game played out from 1-1 to 3-1 and the nature of the performance overall. There’s a look ahead to the Europa League lineup and how much rotation we might see. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 611 - Never Go Full Whiskers

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to celebrate a legendary day of football. It starts with a quick opportunity to laugh at United before going full throttle into a wonderful Arsenal performance. The early discussion focuses on some great goals and the performances of Jesus, Martinelli and Zinchenko. There’s a bit on the way the crowd lifted Saliba and a few of the individual performances that leave some room for improvement including Ramsdale. There’s more on how the right side of the attack can get further involved, and then a bit on the bigger picture. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

There’s a bit on the way the crowd lifted Saliba and a few of the individual performances that leave some room for improvement including Ramsdale. There’s more on how the right side of the attack can get further involved, and then a bit on the bigger picture. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 608 - All Or Nothing Episodes 1-3 Reaction

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the perfect result on opening night complete with great moments and some flaws to address. The conversation starts with comparisons against last season’s opening night and then turns to the opening period of the match. There’s praise for the system and for the forwards as well as a few other players. Saliba and Ben White are discussed at length before the conversation turns to the issues in our midfield as the game wore on. There are some final thoughts about the performance, the other results around the league, and a look ahead. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the big win over Chelsea including the starting lineup, pressing action, Saliba’s influence, Jesus’ quality, Zinchenko’s debut and more performance notes. There’s a bit of projection about places and roles in the team as well. Then the long Edu interview is discussed at length and what it says about the “project.” All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 602 - Chelsea In The Mud, Edu In The Spotlight

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the Orlando City game and lessons learned from preseason as it continues. One big talking point is the hierarchy in attack and who will get the minutes in the front three. There’s a discussion of the left 8 position and how Arteta’s comments clarify or muddy the situation. There’s a bit on Zinchenko’s arrival and the All or Nothing teaser video as well. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 598 - Not Another Jesus Pun

items.content:
On this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the latest news in all its ridiculous splendor. There’s talk of the newest transfer rumors which have moved from the sublime to the ridiculous and how the early window positivity might be facing some challenges now. One important issue that comes up is whether the increased number of games in August puts a premium on getting transfer business done a bit earlier. There’s also a bit on the addition of 5 subs this season and some other odds and ends. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 593 - No More Excuses?

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to assess the potentially massive transfer spend hinted at by the seemingly credible transfer rumors making the rounds. The squad building approach is debated along with views on each possible arrival. There’s also a bit of chat about the rest of the news making the rounds. Later in the episode, Portuguese football expert, Zach Lowy (@BTLvid) makes his debut to provide further insight into Arsenal’s latest signing, Fabio Vieira. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the surprising news of the imminent arrival of Fabio Vieira. The conversation covers the player specifically but also what the signing says about the squad for the upcoming season and possible transfer strategy clues. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 588 - Silly Season Getting Sillier

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) to answer your questions about the transfer window. There are questions about the number of signings, the positions and names to target, the Saliba situation, rethinking the Lacazette purchase, academy and loan player issues, which clubs might fail next season, and many more. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 587 - Transfer Madness Mailbag

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the Champions League Final. The conversation starts with a focus on the shambles from UEFA organizing the event, the experience of fans attending the event, and what, if anything needs to change. The group covers the game with a bit of a focus on the refereeing and what Liverpool’s season was worth. The balance of the pod is spent debating summer ambition, what success looks like for Arsenal in the future and whether the big trophies are still up for grabs. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss some summer squad building plans beginning to emerge. There’s a discussion about Nketiah and Elneny that leads into further conversation about transfer targets like Tielemans and Gabriel Jesus. items.title: Episode 584 - ArsenalVision and Arsecast Season Review LIVE From Union Chapel

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@Stillberto) to discuss a very special weekend filled with meeting wonderful people, an incredible live event, and a fun final day of the season spent at the Emirates (and the Tollington). There’s plenty on the Everton match but also some season-summarizing thoughts, some reactions to the lap of appreciation complete with some speculation. And finally there’s a bit on summer outgoings and incomings. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 583 - The Moment For Reflection Has Arrived

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@Stillberto) to discuss the celebratory upcoming weekend for friends but maybe less celebratory from a supporter standpoint. There’s a conversation about what supporting means to each person, and how that extends beyond results and shapes perceptions. The group addresses the possibility of the miracle outcome this weekend. There’s some discussion about how summer plans will change, if at all, without Champions League and what is needed to compete for top 4 again next season. There’s some analysis of whether this has been a good season and how to balance the different perspectives from a season of streaky results. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 582 - Updating Crucial Summer Transfer Plans

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a devastating loss at Newcastle that leaves the dream of a top 4 finish in tatters. The conversation is a long one that starts with the fear the players showed from the tunnel to the start of the match. There’s a question about why Arsenal couldn’t play past Newcastle’s pressing, including the decision by certain players to go long. Individual performances are highlighted, as well as Arsenal’s record this season when falling behind and the way Arsenal attempted to chase the game against Newcastle. There’s some debate about the media conversation around Arsenal after the match including comments made by Granit Xhaka. The season is reviewed briefly with a focus on the need for more goals and questions about whether certain squad moves derailed the top 4 challenge as the squad became stretched to the limit. There’s also an attempt to reconcile the feeling of disappointment with some of the warmth and positivity that has been felt throughout the season. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
items.content:encoded:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a devastating loss at Newcastle that leaves the dream of a top 4 finish in tatters. The conversation is a long one that starts with the fear the players showed from the tunnel to the start of the match. There’s a question about why Arsenal couldn’t play past Newcastle’s pressing, including the decision by certain players to go long. Individual performances are highlighted, as well as Arsenal’s record this season when falling behind and the way Arsenal attempted to chase the game against Newcastle. There’s some debate about the media conversation around Arsenal after the match including comments made by Granit Xhaka. The season is reviewed briefly with a focus on the need for more goals and questions about whether certain squad moves derailed the top 4 challenge as the squad became stretched to the limit. There’s also an attempt to reconcile the feeling of disappointment with some of the warmth and positivity that has been felt throughout the season. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 581 - That Thursday Football Feeling

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a devastating loss in the derby. The free flowing conversation covers some questions about Arteta’s selections before shifting into a debate about the refereeing and the naive performances from a few Arsenal players. The post match comments from the managers is discussed as well as the ramifications of the result. The podcast wraps up with a look ahead and questions about how Arsenal will cope with critical absences. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 580 - Lost The Battle Now Win The War

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a dominant win that ended with unnecessary nerves at home to Leeds. The conversation starts with a bit about the Emirates atmosphere then moves on to a dominant first half punctuated by 2 Eddie Nketiah goals. His performances is analyzed before attentions turn to other excellent performances from the likes of Martinelli, Odegaard and Mohammed Elneny. There’s additional discussion about Pepe’s sub appearance and the unnecessary nerves at the end of the game before the conversation turns to the Derby and the best way to play against the counter attacking threat of Spurs. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 578 - Mikel Signs

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the Champions League semifinal and how City managed to throw it away. There’s a debate about their squad and contrasting managerial styles, and what it actually takes to be an elite manager at the top of the game. Then the conversation turns to the fixtures at the weekend starting with Spurs trip to Anfield. There’s a brief discussion of what it will take to beat Leeds including how the squad players will play key role which leads into a conversation about squad players generally and who might be kept around and why. After that, Tim (@stillberto) joins the pod to talk Arsenal Women and specifically the derby that was just played and how the season might play out for Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 577 - A Pivotal Weekend

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the “ugly win” over West Ham. It starts with Clive documenting the away day experience before the conversation turns to the incidents in the first half, and the low quality of play generally. There’s a nice conversation about Eddie, and what he is providing at the moment, before the group talks about a few other key performers including Tomiyasu. Second half incidents are discussed, and whether Arsenal got lucky with Bowen’s yellow card for diving. The question of how to keep the wins coming is raised with an eye towards the lineup and approach for the Leeds game. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 576 - A Beautiful Ugly Win

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the West Ham game, transfers, managerial news and more. The discussion starts with a focus on how the lineup might look against West Ham and how to interpret the performances against Chelsea and United in the context of planning for the next few games. Then there’s some transfer discussion focused on Gabriel Jesus before the conversation turns to managerial news, including Klopp’s contract extension. After the break (60:00), Elliot is joined by Kaya Kaynak (@kayakaynak97) from Football London to discuss the state of the squad and some decisions ahead for the manager regarding the attacking trio and midfield specifically. Then there’s a conversation about mentality and how the Arsenal players will be tested during the run in. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Get tickets to the live Arsecast & Arsenalvision event at https://tickets.lnk.to/ArsecastLive
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

Then there’s a conversation about mentality and how the Arsenal players will be tested during the run in. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Get tickets to the live Arsecast & Arsenalvision event at https://tickets.lnk.to/ArsecastLive

items.title: Episode 575 - Stay The Course Or Chop And Change?

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss another chaotic but joyous victory. The conversation attempts to explain the overwhelming chaos that has developed in the last two games and covers the big moments from the game. There’s praise for Saka and Odegaard, plus discussion around the calls that changed the game. The fullback performances are examined with an emphasis on how to evaluate Nuno Tavares. Xhaka and Elneny get their flowers. Then the conversation covers the work left to do and how Arsenal can get over the line to finishing top 4 plus a bit on Gabriel Jesus. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 574 - Can Arsenal Vibes Their Way To the Champions League?

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to celebrate a beautifully chaotic night at Stamford Bridge. There’s a celebratory mood as everyone tries to make sense of a wild first half, starting with the lineup decisions and how they paid off. There’s analysis of the big events and key performances, and the multiple formations used throughout the match. The end of the pod covers where this leaves Arsenal who look fully back in a top 4 race now. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 573 - It’s Back On

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to make sense of a third consecutive loss. The pod covers the moments in the match that made the difference but also spends the lion-share of the time trying to understand how to explain the current slump, the underlying problems, and what can be done about it. Then there’s a look ahead to Chelsea and the opportunity still available to Arsenal this season. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 572 - Ambivalence

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to take your questions on topics ranging from selling Tierney, to how to handle the striker position now, Unai Emery’s performance in the Champions League, rethinking season expectations and the January transfer window, the Tavares signing, Simeone’s football and more. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.

items.title: Episode 571 - Mailbag - Time to Sell Tierney?

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss another painful loss, this time at home to Brighton. The discussion starts trying to explain the lack of intensity and running generally then shifts to how the lineup selection impacted the performance and tactics. There’s a discussion of Lacazette’s continued decline and what Mikel needs to do about it. Then there’s discussion of the absurd VAR call that nullified Martinelli’s goal. Finally there’s a discussion of the goals allowed, the sub performances, and finally, where this Arsenal season is headed. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 570 - Deja Vu All Over Again

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Jessica Black (@jessinhotweets) to discuss the latest injury news and how Mikel Arteta might cope with the absences. There’s a discussion about the system changing, and which players might fit best into new roles. That leads to questions about January and whether Arsenal should have done more in the last window. There’s a debate about what’s achievable now and how we should evaluate the rest of the season before the group looks at Everton’s situation and discusses their cautionary tale, as well as the trials and tribulations of Chelsea in the Champions League and what it says about their team. All that and more on this edition of the ArsenalVision Podcast.
Please support our Arsenal Foundation Fundraiser!
https://www.arsenalvisionpodcast.com/give

items.title: Episode 569 - Is The Partey Over

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a very disappointing performance and result at Crystal Palace. The conversation starts with some curiosity about why so many players were off their best technically and physically. That continues with some specific focus on particularly off nights from Odegaard and Partey. Then there’s a discussion of the errors for the goals as the conversation shifts to Nuno Tavares’ performance and how to handle Tierney’s absence going forward. There’s an obligatory talk about Lacazette’s place in the team before the conversation shifts to a bigger picture look at the top 4 race and how Arsenal handle the upcoming games in the context of the absences from the squad.
Please give to our Arsenal Foundation!
https://www.arsenalvisionpodcast.com/give
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 568 - No Easy Choices Now

items.content:
In this special episode, Elliot is joined by Mairead King from the Arsenal Foundation and James Denslow from Save The Children, to appeal for your support. The ArsenalVision Podcast fundraiser supports the Arsenal Foundation's partner Save The Children, providing critical assistance to refugee children from the war in Ukraine as well as other conflict zones such as Yemen and Syria. When you give, you're entered to win a VIP luxury box experience at the Emirates Stadium for Arsenal's game against Everton on 22 May 2022 with Clive, Tim, Elliot and Andrew Mangan. Help us smash our goal!
https://justgiving.com/fundraising/avpgives
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
items.content:encoded:
In this special episode, Elliot is joined by Mairead King from the Arsenal Foundation and James Denslow from Save The Children, to appeal for your support. The ArsenalVision Podcast fundraiser supports the Arsenal Foundation's partner Save The Children, providing critical assistance to refugee children from the war in Ukraine as well as other conflict zones such as Yemen and Syria. When you give, you're entered to win a VIP luxury box experience at the Emirates Stadium for Arsenal's game against Everton on 22 May 2022 with Clive, Tim, Elliot and Andrew Mangan. Help us smash our goal!

https://justgiving.com/fundraising/avpgives

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Koscielny’s retirement and how he should be viewed by Arsenal fans, what Arsenal should give Bukayo Saka as a new contract, Martinelli’s time with Brazil, Kieran Tierney rumors, and what could happen with William Saliba. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 565 - Big Decisions Ahead

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss the Darwin Nunez rumors. Then they participate in a game of “would you rather” covering topics ranging from signing Haaland, to selling Saka, to resigning Saliba, to following Sp*rs home and away for a season, and many others. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 564 - Darwin Nunez and Would You Sell Saka

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the celebration police taking issue with Arsenal again. Then there’s a discussion of the rough treatment for Saka and the way Gerrard responded to Bukayo defending himself. There’s a bit on Xhaka’s yellow card plus the Partey and Smith Rowe performances. There’s a Lacazette debate then a discussion of the sub performances and finally praise for the defending and the defenders specifically. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 563 - No Celebrations Allowed

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a solid performance against Liverpool that was just missing the final ball. There’s obviously a focus on some exceptional performances, namely Martinelli and Partey, plus a few of the moments where Arsenal failed to capitalize on some openings. The tactical tweaks are discussed including what made the first and second halves a bit different. Then there’s a discussion of the subs, the upcoming fixture list as well as the England call ups. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 562 - Closing The Gap

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an Odegaard masterclass in the victory over Leicester. The conversation starts with the phenomenal Odegaard performance and focuses on how he’s making his teammates better. There’s a discussion about the unity in the dressing room, the balance between the wings, and a look ahead to the challenge Liverpool will present in midweek. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 561 - He Makes Everyone Better

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by James Benge from CBS Sports (@Jamesbenge) to discuss the situation at Chelsea and the possible ramifications in the short and longer term. Then, Tim (@stillberto) joins (45') to touch on the Chelsea situation, the PSG collapse in the Champions League and most importantly to talk some Arsenal, as we look ahead to Leicester at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 560 - Reaping What They Sow

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) and then by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss another Arsenal win highlighted by sensational goals. The conversation covers the brilliant goals, the excellence of the Saka an Odegaard partnership, some defensive questions arising and potential issues getting the left side firing. There’s also a look at the table and some laughter at United’s ineptitude in the Manchester Derby. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 559 - Hang Them In The Louvre

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Chelsea going up for sale, the reasons, repercussions and potential ramifications for Arsenal specifically. Then there’s a bit of time to laugh at Spurs before looking ahead to the Watford game. After the break, Elliot is joined by Mike (@thegoonerspod) to discuss Arsenal’s financials but first to hear about the latest Gooners Versus Cancer fundraiser. items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Adrian Clarke (@adrianjclarke) for a deep dive into the latest tactical tweaks at Arsenal and which players are thriving or struggling with them. Then Elliot is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a rise in ticket prices, the release of Arsenal’s financials from 2020-21 and what they tell us, and a quick discussion about the trip to Watford. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 557 - Mo Money Mo Problems

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an exhilarating victory at the death over Wolves. The conversation starts with the Emirates atmosphere and what the win meant emotionally for the player and for the fans. Then the individual performances are analyzed as well as the evolving system that’s creating more chances but potentially leaving more vulnerabilities. There’s also a discussion about the subs performances and Arteta getting everything right. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 556 - You Cant Fool The Punter

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a dominant performance and good win over Brentford. The pod starts with some discussion of Arsenal’s dominance in possession and territory and the need to begin to improve the final ball as a next step in the team’s development. There’s a discussion of refereeing decisions and then a lot of celebration of Smith Rowe and Saka as well as some debate over whether Martinelli will (and should) come back into the side for Wolves. There’s a bit of Lacazette discussion as well as some table talk in the wake of City’s loss on Saturday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 555 - I Like It I Like It I Like It

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss lessons learned from the Wolves game, especially about the changing system and players thriving and struggling within it. Then there’s a preview of the Brentford game. After the break, Tim (@stillberto) joins the pod to discuss takeaways from the fans forum with Vinai, and Lacazette’s crucial role during the run in. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 554 - Fixer Upper

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the Rams Super Bowl victory through the lens of what it might mean (if anything) for Arsenal. The conversation touches on the KSE business model and if winning in the NFL has any tangible ramifications for the Arsenal project. Then there’s time to laugh and Spurs and United before the pod wraps up with a long discussion of the top 4 scenarios and whether Arsenal should “expect” to finish fourth. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 553 - Arsenal Are NFL Champions

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a massive win at Wolves. The conversation starts with a discussion about how the game started and the patterns of play in the first half. There’s a breakdown of the tactical battle and the players who impressed leading up to the big talking point in the second half. There’s a long discussion about Lacazette’s performance and the way the striker situation impacts our overall chance creation. Then there’s a section on the red card incident, and the conclusions that can be drawn from the decision, and also what overcoming that hardship might mean to the team. Lastly there’s a discussion about contrasting substitutions and a look ahead to what this means for the season. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 551 - Updating Expectations

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to turn the page on the January transfer window. The first part of the podcast covers Aubameyang’s departure. Then the group discusses the club’s decision not to pay the Isak release clause. After that there’s a debate about the future of the striker position this season. Finally there’s a chat about what should happen with Arteta’s contract. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
