items.title: Episode 548 - We Cannot Get This Wrong

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a disappointing home draw to Burnley that saw the big moments go begging. The conversation starts with a focus on the striker situation and the need to convert in the big moments. Then there’s a general discussion about the situation with the squad before the conversation moves to the reasons Arsenal struggled to create openings specifically in the first half. The good period in the second half is analyzed and then the substitutions that happened and didn’t happen. A few individuals are discussed before the group briefly looks ahead. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 546 - A Good Month For The Documentary

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the reaction to the postponement of the North London Derby. There’s a debate over the postponement itself along with a discussion of the rules currently in place and how they may have to change. There’s a further examination of the situations at United and Everton. Then there’s a final look ahead to the next two fixtures and how Arsenal might handle them on the pitch, as well as what might happen in the transfer market. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 545 - Champions Of Twitter

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a heroic draw at Anfield under the circumstances. The pod starts with a discussion about the character and quality displayed by the group that gutted out the draw while down to 10 men and some of the individuals who shined. Then there’s a long segment on the red card and the situation with Xhaka. The pod ends with a look ahead to the Derby with a focus on whether it should and will happen this weekend and if it doesn’t happen, what on earth Arsenal do in midfield. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 544 - Justice For Arsenal

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the loss at Forest in the FA Cup. The first topic about what the loss means in the context of the season and the varying reactions following the match. Then the key moments and performances are analyzed with a focus on the Tavares substitution. The back half of the episode is all about squad depth, transfer possibilities, and how Arsenal manage the next few weeks. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 541 - Let’s Play Two

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the New Year's Day robbery against Manchester City. The refereeing dominates the opening part of the pod before attention turns to Arsenal's excellent play. Some individual match moments are discussed before the pod shifts to individual performances and looks ahead to managing the squad through the upcoming run of cup ties. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 539 - Calendar Year Champions League

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a big win at Norwich and whether something has changed in our game other than simply playing bad opposition. There’s praise for loads of performances with a focus on Bukayo Saka and Martin Odegaard plus a discussion about our current midfield dynamic. There’s also a look ahead to whether Mikel can hold his nerve with this style of play as the fixtures get tougher. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 538 - Breaking The Crapatron

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a fun win over Sunderland with a focus on the players who impressed and their futures at the club, in particular Eddie Nketiah and Nicolas Pépé. There’s some discussion of Arsenal’s improving attack generally, as well as the impending fixture congestion and how Arsenal will handle what’s looking like a tricky period through the month of January. Lastly there’s speculation about whether Arsenal might be active in the January window. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a fun win at Leeds. Then they cover the slow start and ultimately fun win over Southampton including the incidents and performances as well as a look ahead to a big mid-week fixture. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a wide range of topics including the situations with Eddie Nketiah and Folarin Balogun, what to do with the January window, the striker situation generally, and a preview of the Southampton game with a focus on selection issues. Plus a bit on covid calling off the Spurs game. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 533 - Much Ado About Strikers

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss another hugely disappointing loss. The pod starts with focus on the interesting selections and how those influenced the patterns of play. There’s some focus on the refereeing decisions. Then there’s a debate about the problem with the attack and then some strong concerns with the subs. Finally there’s understandable questions asked about the manager and direction of travel. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 532 - We Are What We Repeatedly Do

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the larger themes of the loss at Old Trafford with a focus on the selection, the persistent trend of dropping off after taking the lead, and the performances that made it difficult for us to capitalize against a poor united. Then Tim (@stillberto) joins to go through all the incidents one by one before trying to explain some head-scratching performances and why Arsenal drop off. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Get our latest merch at avpodshop.com
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 531 - A Worrying Trend

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the Newcastle game. The conversation focuses heavily on the decisions Arteta had to make and the way he was rewarded for them, along with the next steps that need to be made in the team’s evolution from an attacking standpoint. Of course there’s also a nice discussion about the goals and the performances that deserve huge credit. Lastly there's a quick preview of the trip to Old Trafford. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 529 - Odecaast

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to breakdown a heavy defeat at Anfield. The discussion covers the selection, what worked early and then failed later on, the performances that underwhelmed, the confrontation between Klopp and Arteta, the problems with the attack, and where Arsenal stand in the pecking order going forward. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:

items.title: Episode 527 - A Measuring Stick

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Sarah Rudd (@srudd_ok) the former head of analytics at Arsenal (and long time Arsenal supporter). The conversation covers a wide range of topics from how analytics are used within football clubs, to the difference between public and non-public data, to the problems with data in football and what the data misses, to the way way data has to be sold to people within clubs and outside of clubs as well as a few anecdotes and more. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Sarah Rudd (@srudd_ok) the former head of analytics at Arsenal (and long time Arsenal supporter). The conversation covers a wide range of topics from how analytics are used within football clubs, to the difference between public and non-public data, to the problems with data in football and what the data misses, to the way way data has to be sold to people within clubs and outside of clubs as well as a few anecdotes and more. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss a variety of topics from the importance of England players in the Arsenal team and vice versa, as well as the recent Josh Kroenke interview and updating evaluations on the impact of KSE’s ownership. After the break (43’) Elliot is joined by Opta Huddersfield analyst and Brighton fan David Hartrick (@davidhartrick) to discuss the breaking news on the Premier League schedule for the 2022 World Cup, Emile Smith Rowe’s development, and the unsurprising success of Benjamin White. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a win against Watford that has Arsenal looking all the way up the table. The conversation starts with the continued evolution of the team’s approach to games and the way they dominated Watford on the ball and in terms of territory on the pitch. The group discusses the critical moments before diving into the critical performances including a special section on Emile Smith Rowe and Bukayo Saka. Aubameyang’s form is discussed. Then there’s some discussion of the way the game ended and what comes next in terms of Arsenal’s continued move up the table. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Get our latest merch at avpodshop.com

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the upcoming game against Watford and what might happen with left back now that Tierney is training. Then the group debates changes that might be needed to ride out the absences Arsenal are facing during African Cup of Nations. After the break (34’) Phil Costa (@_PhilCosta) from Scouted Football joins the show to discuss Arsenal's Academy and the development of Emile Smith Rowe. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a win away at Leicester. The conversation starts with praise for Gabriel and his under the radar player-of-the-season type form. Then there’s a discussion about pressing, the performance of the players up front, and the period of the match where Arsenal dropped off and why that might happen. There’s a lot of praise for Aaron Ramsdale as well as speculation about whether Tavares and Lokonga are making themselves hard to drop. Lastly there’s a bit about the new manager of at the toilet bowl. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 519 - Time To Shine

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Clive to get his thoughts on why Arsenal were able to so thoroughly dominate Aston Villa and whether there were any specific tactical changes that might lead to improvements as the season wears on. Then he touches on his experience being interview for Sky Sports pregame coverage. After the break, Paul (@poznaninmpants) and Tim (@stillberto) join the pod to cover more specific individual performances that stood out from the game and of course there’s time to laugh at United and wonder about what we can still achieve this season. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 518 - It's Back On

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmpants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a draw that left us with more questions than answers about the system and in particular the midfield. There are break downs of some individual performances, the errors leading to goals and questions about ways to change things that might make a difference. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 517 - Is This Winning Football

items.content:
This show was recorded in front of a live audience at The Victoria Tavern with Clive, Tim, James McNicholas, James Benge, Elliot and Mairead from the Arsenal Foundation. The first section discusses the Arsenal Foundation's philanthropic projects. After that, the panel takes a shot at explaining "the process" before answering listener questions on topics ranging from player performances to managerial issues, to tactics and more.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 516 - Live At The Victoria Tavern

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a few topics but starting with news that the podcast winning “best Premier League podcast” at the Football Content Awards last night and sharing a few thoughts on a memorable evening that is a reflection of a community of listeners that can’t be beat! Then the group discusses the even Tim was invited to cover with a data company responsible for collecting player fitness and biometric data and how the club are using it in a variety of interesting ways. After that, it’s a full on Palace preview, before a couple kind words at the very end. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 514 - October Mailbag

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Scott (Oh_that_crab) to discuss how much time it will take for NUFC to climb the league table, and what to make of our successful 4 game run. Then Dan Potts (@danarsenal87) joins to compare preseason expectations to reality. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 512 - The Landscape Has Changed

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to breakdown what went wrong at a very wet Amex on Saturday night. They cover the extent to which the conditions mattered, and some individually sloppy performances that made life difficult. There’s analysis of why Arsenal couldn’t play out from Brighton’s pressure, the extent to which Arsenal went long, and the execution issues in midfield. The group discusses Xhaka’s absence as well. There’s a debate about the substitutions and praise for the center backs. Lastly, the Liverpool-City match is discussed as it relates to the level Arsenal aspire to reach. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 511 - Wet and Sloppy Saturday Night

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to laugh at Spurs again before looking ahead to Brighton away. The discussion focuses on Xhaka’s absence and how Arteta might choose to replace him and whether that presents an opportunity for certain players. There’s a discussion of some of the players on the fringe of the first team and also a look around the league generally at the weaknesses of a few clubs Arsenal are competing with for European places. Plus a bit on the likability of the squad now. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

The discussion focuses on Xhaka’s absence and how Arteta might choose to replace him and whether that presents an opportunity for certain players. There’s a discussion of some of the players on the fringe of the first team and also a look around the league generally at the weaknesses of a few clubs Arsenal are competing with for European places. Plus a bit on the likability of the squad now. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 509 - Lee Dixon on THE Arsenal

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to luxuriate in the absolute demolition of Tottenham in the North London Derby. Every performance and stellar moment gets its fair share of the praise before the group discusses the wider implications of the victory. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 508 - Hale End Supremacy

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the comfortable League Cup victory over Wimbledon and look ahead to the North London Derby coming this Sunday. First the group covers standout performances from the league cup victory and discusses how the manager can find minutes for players who haven’t played much this season. Then the attention turns to the derby and firstly whether Granit Xhaka will come back into the starting XI. After the Xhaka talk, there’s a more general discussion of what to expect from Spurs and the importance of the fixture generally. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Get our latest merch at avpodshop.com
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 507 - Derby Day Reckoning

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss another 1-0 win, this time at Burnley. There’s a discussion of the preferred starting XI starting to take shape and how the formation might impact future selection. Then there’s discussion of some individual performances including a few missed opportunities in attack, a brilliant goal and Ben White dodging some bullets with his passing, plus Ramsdale’s growing influence and the impressive substitutes and what will happen with the future of the midfield. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Get our latest merch at avpodshop.com

items.title: Episode 504 - A Perfect Start

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the state of squad coming back from the international break, the news from the manager, and what to expect against Norwich. Then the pod shifts to asking some burning questions we would like to have answered over the next six league fixtures. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 503 - Burning Questions

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a number of topic’s beginning with Arsenal’s Women defeating Chelsea. After covering that game, the conversation moves on to Edu’s interview, the project arsenal are undertaking and whether the talent level is sufficient. Finally, the group looks ahead to the next six fixtures and whether this is a run where Arteta’s job might be on the line. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 502 - It’s All About Talent

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Drew Tyler for 18 minutes to discuss the Arsenal Foundation fundraiser and how the foundation helps make a significant difference around the world. Then Elliot is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Tomiyasu’s arrival and what he brings to the team. There’s a conversation about Xhaka not playing for Switzerland. Finally, the group grades the incomings and outgoings for the window. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 500 - Remembering What Matters

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a very fun 6-0 win over WBA in the League Cup. The pod starts with some discussion of the importance of getting the good feeling back and how much the individual performances matter, with Saka and Aubameyang specifically discussed. Additional aspects of the performance are covered before the conversation turns to City at the weekend and how to approach that challenging fixture. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 499 - Hope You Enjoyed It

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a very dispiriting Chelsea game that was played amid very unfortunate circumstances. The group dissects a confusing system and the players who may have underperformed in spite of some odd instructions. Performances are analyzed and debated before the group looks ahead to the upcoming fixtures before the international break. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 498 - A Lazy Susan Of Cr*p

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the signing of Martin Odegaard and what it means for the short term and long term prospects. Then the group discusses the latest team news, the Covid situation, and what it means for the weekend. Finally there’s a discussion of the impending Aaron Ramsdale transfer. Lastly, there’s a brief preview of the Chelsea game. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 497 - The Window Has Slammed Open

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a worrying opening night at Brentford. First Tim gives his appraisal of the experience being at the game, then each person gives his “one big thing” on his mind about Arsenal at this moment. After that there’s a full breakdown of the game, individual performances that stood out, and the situation that is facing the club with difficult fixtures ahead. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 495 - Season Predictions

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the Joe Willock sale, and what other business is desperately needed. Then they examine the issues from the Spurs preseason game and debate whether Arsenal look ready for the new season to begin. Then Elliot is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) to explore why Arsenal lack creativity and what might be needed to create more chances. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Jessica Black (@itsjessinho) to cover all the transfer rumors and rate their veracity. There’s coverage of Guimaraes, Ramsdale, Lautaro Martinez, James Maddison and Odegaard. Then the group covers the highlights from the Watford friendly including performances from ESR, Pepe, Lokonga and what will happen at left wing and right back for opening day. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 490 - Rating The Rumors

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an encouraging preseason friendly against Millwall and the squad and transfer questions that spring from that game. Before the main chat, there’s a brief call to donate to Gooners Versus Cancer, and you can learn more at the link below or @goonersvcancer. Then Tim, Paul and Elliot cover topics that include the impressive performances of Partey and Lokonga and what they expect to happen this summer in terms of additional midfield changes and how important that will be. There’s a debate about these striker position and whether Lacazette should be kept to see out his contract. The group debates the other forward positions as well as ESR’s increased pressure to perform this season and whether the club should bring in a reinforcement at his preferred position including potentially Odegaard or James Madison. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Support Gooners Versus Cancer at https://events.lls.org/pages/nca/goonersvscancer2021
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Get our limited edition ESR merch at avpodshop.com

items.title: Episode 489 - It Will Define This Rebuild

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Smith Rowe’s new contract and new number. The conversation includes a debate about whether another “10” needs to be added this summer. There’s some discussion of the cancelled Florida Cup and Arsenal’s disrupted preseason. Then the group covers some weird rumors, namely Aaron Ramsdale and Jordan Henderson. Plus there’s discussions of what should happen in midfield this summer and at striker too. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 488 - ESR 10

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s announcement that Lokonga has signed with the club. The group praises the move and debates what role the player could have in the near term. There’s a brief discussion of the Club’s trip to Florida and whether it could be in jeopardy. Then there’s a discussion about the game against Rangers with a focus on Smith Rowe, Tavares, Aubameyang and Balogun. Lastly the group looks ahead to the remaining transfer business that needs to be done. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 486 - Willock and Abraham Rumors As Preseason Begins

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to send love to Bukayo Saka, and discuss the circumstances surrounding the Euro 2020 Final as well as the fallout from the event. The discussion includes the situation Saka found himself in and what it might mean for him going forward, the future of the England team, and a big discussion about the societal implications of the behavior of some groups of people before, during and after the final. Then attentions turn to the start of Arsenal’s preseason and hopefully some transfer activity. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Euro 2020 Daily - It's All Or Nothing

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Andrew (@arseblog) to discuss the summer of Saka. They cover his immense potential along with his understated personality and the extent to which his Arsenal season might be impacted by the Euros. Then they discuss some competition for places up front at Arsenal this season. After the break (22:00) Elliot is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to cover a variety of topics starting with Tim’s day out at the Semifinal and the game in general. The then group talks about Saka’s performance and bright future as well as some transfer rumors. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to announce the Vegas event once and for all, plus to discuss all the transfer rumors including ESR to Villa, plus Tavares, Lokonga, White, Ramsdale and Maddison. Then the group discusses whether the richest clubs in the league can be caught up and how we can debate what the club does without reducing it to positivity and negativity. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss transfer rumors, player valuations, and how to make Arsenal’s money go the farthest this summer. The conversation is mostly focused on Ben White and James Maddison links but also touches on who should be sold, how to get the most out of the young players next season, and a quick bit on Andre Silva as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 479 - How to Value White and Maddison

Elliot is joined by Phil Costa (@_PhilCosta) to cover the last 2 days at Euro 2020. The conversation starts with expressions of relief at Christian Eriksen’s recovery. Then it’s on to the football, firstly with a focus on the England game which gets special attention. Then there’s a rapid fire discussion of the other games played over the weekend and a look ahead to Monday.

items.title: Euro 2020 Daily - Opening Night

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss transfer rumors and the latest news. Discussions include Nketiah’s new deal, Onana’s reduced suspension, making sense of transfer rumors that imply different strategies, and how the club should proceed. After the break there’s Euro 2020 talk, with most of the focus on England’s young talent. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 476 - Euro 2020 Preview

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss transfer rumors! First up is the Buendia move to Aston Villa and whether the group considers it a missed opportunity. Next up is Ruben Neves and whether he’d be a good fit and an exciting addition. That leads to a small discussion of Arsenal generally being good or bad operators in the market compared to what other clubs are doing. There’s a brief discussion about Xhaka leaving and a summary of his time at the club. Then there’s some additional news items including Balogun getting a chance to compete for his place in the team next season and what that means for Lacazette and Martinelli. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

First up is the Buendia move to Aston Villa and whether the group considers it a missed opportunity. Next up is Ruben Neves and whether he’d be a good fit and an exciting addition. That leads to a small discussion of Arsenal generally being good or bad operators in the market compared to what other clubs are doing. There’s a brief discussion about Xhaka leaving and a summary of his time at the club. Then there’s some additional news items including Balogun getting a chance to compete for his place in the team next season and what that means for Lacazette and Martinelli. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 475 - All Transfer Rumors Are True

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Bukayo Saka scoring for England and what lies ahead for his summer. Then there’s a debate about the rumor that Luis Campos could come in as a consultant for Arsenal this summer. There’s analysis of the Onana rumor, some talk about Ancelotti leaving Everton as well as Conte possibly going to Spurs. Then there’s a discussion about Brentford and what their promotion might mean for the changing state of football club management. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to break down the Champions League final, how it played out, the way Arsenal fans reacted to it and what, if anything, it tells us about how Arsenal operate. Then the group moves on to transfer rumors, what the club needs to do this summer, and who could be coming and going. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Season Review

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the win over Brighton and a return of fans to the emirates. There’s plenty on the individual performances, notably Pepe. There’s some discussion about the future for Odegaard, Willock and a few other players on the periphery. That leads to some speculation about how to build the squad for a season without Europe. Plus there’s a discussion of Edu’s future as some ominous reports emerge. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Spurs Are Off To Xhakastan

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the win at Crystal Palace. The group attempts to explain why Arsenal aren’t creating more chances. Then there’s a section about the awful refereeing. After that some of the individual performances are evaluated including Aubameyang, Pepe, Gabriel, Smith Rowe, Odegaard and Martinelli. The group also wonders about the future of Joe Willock. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Talent Makes The Job Easier

items.content:
Elliot is joined by French football commentator and author of Sacre Bleu: From Zidane to Mbappe, Matt Spiro (@Mattspiro) to discuss William Saliba. The conversation covers the signing, his first loan season in France, his challenging start to life at Arsenal, his subsequent loan back to France, and where it goes from here. Plus there’s a very brief discussion of Matteo Guendouzi.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: It’s Finally Time For Transfer Talk

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s 1-0 victory over Chelsea. The discussion starts by comparing the elation of the result with reactions to the performance. The group dissects the use of Saka this season, the effectiveness of the pressing we’ did, and another star turn from Smith Rowe. There are questions about whether Odegaard is the player we need going forward, as well as reactions to Arteta’s post match comments. items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s competent performance and win over West Brom. The conversation starts with questions about the lineup and whether it makes sense to use certain players who aren’t part of the club’s future. Then the discussion moves on to individual performances with specific attention to Saka, Martinelli and Pepe. There’s a discussion about Arteta’s comments about Smith Rowe as well as questions about who should have control over the club’s summer budget. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Just To Be Vindictive

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s dismal failure in the second leg of the Europa League semifinal. The first section of the pod focuses more specifically on the game specifically, the individual performances, and the failures managerially. The second section after the break (45:00) is devoted entirely to assessing Arteta, whether there are remaining arguments for keeping him, making the case for moving on, and exploring why this seems to have failed. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Hypothetical Success and Concrete Failure

items.content:
Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Grant Wahl (@grantwahl) to discuss the culture clash facing European Football and how that was manifested in the ill-conceived Super League proposal. There's also a discussion of the protests that have followed the announcement as well as a brief look at the future of Women's club football.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
Find Grant's podcast, Planet Futbol, at https://podfollow.com/999062153

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Football’s Culture Clash with Grant Wahl

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss Arsenal’s victory over Newcastle, the protests at Old Trafford, and look ahead to Thursday’s crucial Europa League semifinal second leg. The player performances from Sunday are analyzed in the context of what Arteta might do in midweek. There’s special focus on the right back situation as well as the performances of Martinelli and Aubameyang. Then there’s a discussion of the protests at Old Trafford that tries to add some nuance to the conversation. After the break, (58:30) Alex Kirkland (@alexkirkland) from The Spanish Football Podcast comes on to discuss the Europa League tie from the Spanish perspective plus views on Emery, Arteta and Thomas Partey specifically. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: I Love Him More Than You

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s hugely disappointing performance in the first leg of the Europa League semifinal against Villarreal. The group discusses Arteta’s problematic setup from the start. The goals are analyzed. Then there’s a discussion of Ceballos’ performance and Arteta’s failure to take him off. The conversation continues with the Emery halftime sub, Arteta’s lack of urgency to change things, the penalty, and where the tie goes from here. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: No One Understands Calculus

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to relive the Everton game and make sense of what exactly went wrong with the performance. First there’s a quick discussion about the protest related to ownership and the impact that has on the football. Then the game is discussed at length including a few performances of note. There’s a deep dive on the goalkeeper and what the manager needs to do at that position, plus a big look ahead to Thursday and whether we might see a surprising change of formation and personnel. There’s even a quick discussion about what to do with Joe Willock. Then Elliot is joined by Akhil Vyas (@10akhil) from the board of the Arsenal Supporters Trust (1:18:00). Akhil covers discussions between the AST and British Government, some of the talking points from the fans forum, and what needs to happen and could happen regarding the ownership of Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to relive the Everton game and make sense of what exactly went wrong with the performance. First there’s a quick discussion about the protest related to ownership and the impact that has on the football. Then the game is discussed at length including a few performances of note. There’s a deep dive on the goalkeeper and what the manager needs to do at that position, plus a big look ahead to Thursday and whether we might see a surprising change of formation and personnel. There’s even a quick discussion about what to do with Joe Willock. Then Elliot is joined by Akhil Vyas (@10akhil) from the board of the Arsenal Supporters Trust (1:18:00). Akhil covers discussions between the AST and British Government, some of the talking points from the fans forum, and what needs to happen and could happen regarding the ownership of Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: The Dumbest Coup

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@Stillberto) to discuss the bombshell news of the impending formation of the European Super League. This is a long and nuanced debate that attempts to get at the core issues around why this is happening, how it will change football, whether it will go forward, and what it means for all of us as fans. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: We Care, We Worry, We Are Desperate

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@Stillberto) discuss a comfortable win in Prague that send Arsenal into the semifinals of the Europa League where they will face former manager Unai Emery. The conversation starts with a detailed discussion of the new formation and tactical tweaks that Arteta has made in the absence of Kieran Tierney. Individual performances are analyzed, as well as a brief discussion of the status of the striker competition between Lacazette and Aubameyang. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Bring On The Protagonists

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), and Tim (@Stillberto) discuss a fun win at Sheffield United. They discussion starts with an attempt to dissect the strange tactics and setup for the game and why it worked and who benefitted from it. The goals are broken down along with individual performances, especially from Partey, Lacazette, Martinelli and Ceballos. The group discusses the Aubameyang situation and looks ahead to Thursday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: A Bit Of Serenity

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), and Tim (@Stillberto) discuss a disappointing home draw with Slavia Prague in the first leg of our Europa League Quarter Final. A large portion of this conversation focuses on the lineup choices and the lateness of the substitutions. The group tries to explain what Arteta was trying to accomplish and the ways in which he missed an opportunity. Performances are analyzed including a real head scratcher from Thomas Partey. There’s plenty of talk about the missed chances and the goal that Arsenal conceded late. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Just Keep It Simple

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@Stillberto) to try to make sense of a poor performance and awful result against Liverpool. The episode starts with a focus on the lineup before exploring the worrying performance from Dani Ceballos. The group discusses what went wrong and why Arteta wasn’t able to change it. There’s a discussion about Aubameyang’s deployment on the left and his performance generally. Then there’s an argument. A pretty long argument. The argument focuses on Arteta and whether it’s time to re-evaluate him, how to contextualize our results versus our form since Boxing Day, and when it’s right to think about changing a manager. After the break, Elliot is joined by Dr. Rajpal Brar (@3cbperformance) to discuss injuries to Kieran Tierney and David Luiz. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Progress Reports

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@Stillberto) to review our biggest takes from the last year of football and admit what we got wrong as well as celebrating what we got right. Topics include, Aubameyang’s contract, Arteta’s performance, how to watch the games, Willian on the left, Cedric’s fit in the team and more! All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Mistakes Were Made

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a wild draw at West Ham. The first section covers the challenging first half hour as a debate erupts over why it was so poor. Then Thomas Partey gets praise for a dominant performance during Arsenal’s fight back. There’s huge praise for the man of the match, Martin Odegaard, plus plenty of credit given to the surprisingly excellent Chambers. Lacazette gets his credit but there’s some criticism for Aubameyang as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: I Didn’t Know He Was This Good

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to cover a variety of topics. First the group laughs at Spurs crashing out of the Europa League. Next they discuss the draw and how favorable it appears for Arsenal. Then the discussion moves to the Olympiacos game and performances from Ceballos, Aubameyang, Odegaard, Martinelli and Bellerin. Lastly, there’s a bit of a preview of the West Ham match on Sunday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Can’t Smile Without Them

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to celebrate a fantastic Derby victory. Topics before the break include: the fantastic work of ESR and Tierney on the left, the effectiveness of the press, the early setback, Martin Odegaard, the great center back performances, Lacazette’s complicated day, and the Pepe substitution. After the break there’s a long discussion of Aubameyang, plus the poor finish to the game, and what the win means for the season. North London is once again Red! All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 449 - Rewarded For Our Dominance

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss an unusual but excellent win in Greece. Topics include the lineup and especially Willian’s selection, early dominance, targeting Saka, Odegaard’s uneven play but excellent goal, the self destruct button, the flat period after their equalizer, the subs, and the goalzos. Then there’s a preview of the weekend’s huge derby. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Just Like We Planned

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s extraordinarily frustrating draw against Burnley. Topics include the lineup, our early dominance, their goal, the subs, the penalty incidents, the late missed chances, and what to make of the season now. After the break we take your questions including a particularly spicy one about Klopp. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 447 - VAR! What Is It Good For?

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s upcoming trip to Burnley, possible lineup choices in light of the fixtures ahead, and what to expect from the game. Then they discuss Arteta’s recent comments bout Eddie Nketiah and Folarin Balogun which leads to a discussion about the future of both players and the future of Arsenal’s current crop of academy players generally. After the break (51:00) Elliot is joined by Aaron West (@oeste) to discuss Bukayo Saka’s meteoric rise, the crop of young talent at Arsenal which is reminiscent of another club that had success with a young trio, Arteta pulling things back from the brink and Aaron’s approach to interviewing Footballers. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s upcoming trip to Burnley, possible lineup choices in light of the fixtures ahead, and what to expect from the game. Then they discuss Arteta’s recent comments bout Eddie Nketiah and Folarin Balogun which leads to a discussion about the future of both players and the future of Arsenal’s current crop of academy players generally. After the break (51:00) Elliot is joined by Aaron West (@oeste) to discuss Bukayo Saka’s meteoric rise, the crop of young talent at Arsenal which is reminiscent of another club that had success with a young trio, Arteta pulling things back from the brink and Aaron’s approach to interviewing Footballers. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Xavi, Iniesta and Messi

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a fantastic victory over Leicester. Topics include: rotation choices, squad strength, the early concession of a goal, individual performances from Pepe, Willian, Mari, Cedric, Odegaard and others, the ESR injury, Martinelli’s path to playing time, and a look ahead in Arsenal’s league season. Then Elliot is joined by Dr. Rajpal Brar (@3cbPerformance) (at 1:15) to discuss ESR’s injury prognosis, Martinelli’s return tot he team and long term injury recovery generally, how to manage minutes and why it’s important, and a few other topics. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Don't Worry About Lineups

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a heart-stopping Europa League victory over Benfica. Topics include: the emotions at full time versus the emotions a day after, the inclusion of ESR and Odegaard together, the brilliance of Bukayo Saka, the effectiveness of Aubameyang at center forward, the character and quality of Kieran Tierney, and the decision to bring on Willian, along with some talk about the upcoming Leicester game. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a fairly uneventful loss to Manchester City. Topics include: reaction to a game against superior opposition, the tactical approach, the nearly moments we didn’t capitalize on, the problem on the right, Auba’s performance, subs and the question of rotation, and a look ahead to Benfica. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Death By Bongo Bongo

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a disappointing draw on an evening of missed opportunities against Benfica. Topics include a quick assessment of the pitch’s impact on the game, the lineup and impact of fatigue, the central midfield performance, how Benfica’s tactics invited us to smash them, Aubameyang’s frustrating evening, subs, what happens with the tie now, and City at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: A Result To Match The Performance

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to cover the news from the week. They talk injuries, specifically Partey and Tierney, and how Arteta prepared for Leeds aggressive pressing with an eye towards Benfica. The conversation continues with a debate about squad building and the benefit of depth versus strengthening the first XI. The group debates the Leeds game generally and what the lineup should look like, especially at center forward. Lastly, they discuss Martinelli and how he makes his way back into the side. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 440 - No Tierney No Partey

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the loss at Aston Villa as Arsenal are once again punished to the maximum extent from a single error. The conversation focuses on how the team was impacted playing from behind the entire game, the buildup play, the substitutions, refereeing decisions and poor refereeing generally, and the play of our two main strikers. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 439 - More Harsh Punishment

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a heartbreaking loss to Wolves thanks largely to refereeing decisions. The first part of the pod focuses on good moments from the first half and the performances that excited the group. Then there’s a detailed discussion of the penalty incident, the rules of the game, and problems with refereeing. At the end the group discusses a little bit of the play in the second half and what the result means for Arsenal’s Premier League campaign. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 438 - Focus On The Positives

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the draw against United as well as the transfer window. The pod opens with a brief discussion of Mustafi’s departure. Then there’s a long breakdown of the United game with emphasis on performances from Pepe, Xhaka, Partey, Cedric, Luiz and more. There’s a debate about the young players leaving on loan as well as a discussion about who will be the first choice option at certain key positions going forward, and a brief look ahead to Wolves tomorrow. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 437 - Sliding Out Of The Club

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a good win over Southampton. There’s a discussion of the more front-footed approach and whether that can and should continue, and how the press influences our attack. Individual performances including Pepe, Cedric, Saka and the central midfield are analyzed. Then the discussion turns to a preview of United on Saturday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 436 - On The Front Foot

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Chelsea sacking Frank Lampard, Odegaard’s impending arrival, and the FA cup exit. The cup conversation focuses on the lineup and particularly performances from Willian and Pepe. There’s also a bit of Mustafi talk and some Balogun chat as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 435 - Eu deg aa rd

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants), Scott (@oh_that_crab) and Clive (@clivepafc) to the big braking news that Martin Odegaard might be coming to Arsenal. They cover all the angles to the deal and what the player brings to the team, the discuss briefly the acquisition of Matt Ryan to backup Bernd Leno. Then Jessica Black, the host of She Knows Arsenal (@itsjessinho) joins the pod to cover the latest breaking news, summarize the season so far, and discuss the situation with Pepe and Willian. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 434 - MO10 Redux

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a 3-0 win over Newcastle. The conversation focuses heavily on the midfield performances and how they unlocked the game. It also covers praise for ESR and Saka, and how their development is such a boon for the club generally. There's praise for Cedric and a discussion of the fullback hierarchy as well as an Aubameyang discussion. The pod ends with a look forward to a very tricky run ahead for Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

The conversation focuses heavily on the midfield performances and how they unlocked the game. It also covers praise for ESR and Saka, and how their development is such a boon for the club generally. There's praise for Cedric and a discussion of the fullback hierarchy as well as an Aubameyang discussion. The pod ends with a look forward to a very tricky run ahead for Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 433 - Midfield Masterclasses

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a drab 0-0 draw against Crystal Palace. First there’s some pun-laden Richard Garlick talk. Then the focus is on the Arsenal attacking woes and how to fix the tempo and threat that was so lacking against Palace, especially without Kieran Tierney. Individual performances analyzed include Luiz, AMN, Xhaka, Partey and Pepe. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 432 - Cooking With Garlick

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s 3rd FA Cup tie victory over Newcastle. The episode starts with questions about Willian’s performance and the performance of the midfield generally. This develops into a discussion about some of the young players at the club and whether it’s time for some to move on as others step up. There’s praise for defenders and then a discussion about the players who came on and changed the game, notably, Emile Smith Rowe. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 431 - Moving On

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the latest headlines with a big focus on Mesut Ozil’s seemingly impending departure. They discuss his career at Arsenal and how to summarize it with respect to the 2 distinct periods. Then the group covers the Saliba quotes and situation surrounding him, before touching on the latest incoming and outgoing transfer rumors. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 430 - Thanks For (Some Of) The Memories

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to enjoy Arsenal sticking it to Sam Allardyce. The group covers all the exceptional performances while asking questions about Aubameyang and how the trio of youngsters revitalizing the team impacts the roles of certain more senior members of the squad. The pod attempts to identify the changes tactically and in player performances that have allowed Arsenal to finally unlock some attacking verve. Theres a big section on Kieran Tierney and potential selection headaches in the front line. There’s also debate about what’s still to come this season and in the transfer window. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 429 - Playing In A Tierney Wonderland

items.content:
Happy New Year! On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to celebrate another win. They cover the difference between a drab first half and excellent attacking 20 minutes after halftime to earn the win. There’s praise for Saka, Martinelli and ESR again, but also some concerns about Aubameyang. The group talks about the table and what can still be achieved this season, along with a bit about the January transfer window and the return of Thomas Partey. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 428 - Blow The Whistle Ref

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to celebrate a Boxing Day victory over Chelsea. They cover the excitement of positive results, the lineup, the influence of the younger players. There’s a breakdown of several performances as well as some speculation about how this will influence Arteta going forward and what to expect in the upcoming features. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to celebrate a Boxing Day victory over Chelsea. They cover the excitement of positive results, the lineup, the influence of the younger players. There’s a breakdown of several performances as well as some speculation about how this will influence Arteta going forward and what to expect in the upcoming features. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast 
 See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to wish you a Merry Christmas and answer your questions, including lots on potential managerial appointments, January transfers and the William Saliba situation. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 426 - A Very Merry Mailbag

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss another loss, this time at Everton. The group covers the first half abomination, a second half where Everton sat off, and whether this squad is sitting where it belongs in the table. There’s a long chat about the structure at the club and the commitment to mediocrity. There’s focus on Willian’s performance and Arteta’s quotes about deserving to win. Finally, Scott (oh_that_crab) joins to give a statistical context to Arsenal’s malaise. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 425 - A Failure That Has Many Fathers

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a needed but ugly point at home to Southampton. The pod starts discussing how the game began, the simple mistakes being made, and why the easy things seem so hard at the moment. Then the pod moves on to the goal conceded and goal scored and some of the good football played in between the two. Then there’s a long segment on the way Arsenal played down a man and whether it should be considered creditable or unacceptable. Finally the group wonders how Arsenal will fare over the next three trick fixtures. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 424 - Let’s Never Speak About It Again

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a dismal home defeat to Burnley. The pod starts with a discussion of the football specifically and what was working and what wasn’t before Xhaka’s red card. The balance of the pod covers three topics: Xhaka’s red car, Arteta’s future at Arsenal and the stupidity of how the club has been run. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 423 - Stupidity All The Way Down

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a fun win in the final Europa League group game. There’s a discussion of Arteta’s spiky press conference, the performance of the kids and whether they should be given more opportunities and why the EL team is able to do some things the PL team cannot. There’s a very big discussion on what happens with Balogun and what will happen with his future. Lastly there’s a quick mention of what’s happening in France. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 422 - Balogun or Balogone

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss an awful Derby Day. There’s lineup and system talk, plenty of debate about the Partey and discussion about what’s going on with Aubameyang. The group analyzes the amount of crosses and why it’s happening. There’s also some Mesut Ozil discussion as the pod moves into a Bellerin conversation and a discussion about the bench selection. Then there’s longer debate about the manager and how he recovers form the hole he and the team are in. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss an awful Derby Day. There’s lineup and system talk, plenty of debate about the Partey and discussion about what’s going on with Aubameyang. The group analyzes the amount of crosses and why it’s happening. There’s also some Mesut Ozil discussion as the pod moves into a Bellerin conversation and a discussion about the bench selection. Then there’s longer debate about the manager and how he recovers form the hole he and the team are in. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 420 - Just Beat Spurs

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a dispiriting loss to Wolves at the Emirates. The pod starts with a discussion of Wolves ability to constantly create danger on the counter-attack. Then there’s a brief discussion of head injuries and how David Luiz’s injury was handled. After that, the group debates the lack of response in the second half. There’s a discussion of Aubameyang’s dreadful form and the causes for it. Then there’s a conversation about the state of the squad and what it means for Arteta’s immediate future. Finally the impending NLD is discussed. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 419 - Sunk Cost Fallacy Is Alive And Well At Arsenal

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a poor draw away to Leeds. The pod starts with a discussion of a decent start that gave way to a dreadful performance overall. There’s a debate about the tactics and lineup along with an examination of the midfield. Then the pod turns mostly to discussions of Willian and Pepe and where Arteta goes from here with his man management. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 418 - Is The Air Hostess Panicking

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), to discuss the fallout from the Interlull and the pre-match comments from the manager with an eye towards his selection for Leeds on Sunday. After the match preview there’s a long discussion about KSE in the context of the article put out by The Athletic chronicling the evolution of the owners’ involvement in the club. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 416 - November Mailbag

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a dispiriting loss at home to Aston Villa. A lot of this conversation focuses on the moribund attack and whether the system, the players, or a combination of the two is to blame. There’s some efforts to analyze how it can be rectified and whether it can be done with the players in the squad. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
