items.title: Episode 415 - We Were Beaten Good And Proper

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto). The conversation is mostly focused on Joe Willock and Nicolas Pepe, their performance in this game, and whether they have a strong case to be first choice selections in the Premier League. After that the group discusses Willian’s role, the midfield audition for a place next to Thomas Partey. After that there’s a discussion of how to handle the Europa League going forward and a brief look ahead to Villa at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 414 - Willock And Pepe Eradicate Molde

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a huge win at Old Trafford after 14 years of disappointment. The pod starts simply by celebrating the victory before diving into the tactics and performances. There’s a discussion of the pressing and why and how it worked that leads naturally into a conversation about the midfield, and first Mohammed Elneny. There’s a brief discussion of Hector Bellerin and the use of the right flank, then Thomas Partey gets the attention he richly deserves. The pod finishes with praise for the center backs before wondering about the left wing position and looking ahead to what comes next in a wild season of Premier League football. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 413 - The Twilight Zone

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a fun and easy victory over Dundalk in the Europa League. The pod starts with a brief discussion of Huss Fahmy and then moves on to the game. The focus of that discussion is the performance of Joe Willock and Reiss Nelson and the ramifications, if any, for their first team opportunities. Joe Willock in particular is analyzed carefully. Then the group discusses Pepe’s goal and how to evaluate such a mercurial player. Finally the group looks ahead to United away at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 412 - Can We Play You Every Week

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a disappointing loss to Leicester that was split into two very different halves. The pod analyzes what went right the first half, what didn’t work, and what to make of Lacazette. Then the pod focuses heavily on fixing the attack with an emphasis on what needs to be done about Auba, Partey and Pepe. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 411 - I Don't Like Stupidity

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a slightly ugly victory in Vienna. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. The pod starts with the good: Thomas Partey. There’s also praise for Gabriel. Then the pod gets to some concerns, including Leno, Lacazette and Cedric. The group discusses concerns with the attack and the commitment to a certain system and use of resources on the pitch and what it means for Arsenal going forward. Lastly there’s a quick look ahead to Leicester on Sunday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 410 - How The Sausage Gets Made

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s 1-0 loss at Manchester City. The big talking point is the selection of Willian up front and the thought process behind that. The group analyzes why it was done and how it impacted the team. There’s a general discussion of attacking intent and the use of the forward line and how Arteta can change things going forward. The major incidents of the game are broken down and then the group discusses the progress being made under Arteta and whether concerns about the attack are valid at this point in the process. Finally there’s a discussion about the situation in the league generally and whether everything is up for grabs. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 409 - Schrodinger's Striker

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Project Big Picture. The group takes on the debate about the proposal and what it means for the future of football and inevitable change. After that there’s a brief discussion about pay-per-view, before the conversation turns to Arsenal and specifically the situations with William Saliba and then Mesut Ozil. Finally, there’s a brief preview of the big game against Man City on Saturday. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 408 - Project Big Problem

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s last minute signing of Thomas Partey. There’s excitement about what he brings to the team on the pitch as well as questions about the structure of the deal from a squad building standpoint and what we need from the midfielder. The conversation covers a range of topics about how Partey will be used and what it will mean tactically. Then the pod rates the transfer window before finishing with a bit on Gunnersaurus. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 407 - Insert Partey Pun Here

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s win over Liverpool at Anfield in the League Cup. The conversation focuses on the good and less good performances and whether its time for Areteta to consider a change in our system in an effort to stimulate the attack. There’s a long discussion of Saka and the setup in the forward line, and then some conversation about the midfield, before heaping praise on Leno. The penalty shootout is discussed and then the pod wraps up with some talk about Saliba’s rumored loan back to France. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 406 - The Competition That Matters

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s 3-1 loss at Anfield. This conversation covers a range of issues confronting the team and manager at the moment and also acknowledges that this game presents a challenge that may be beyond Arsenal at the moment. There’s a debate about the selection and a focus on the issues midfield. There’s also a good discussion of Aubameyang’s role, plus Willian’s performance and what to make of him at this early stage of his Arsenal career. The defense is analyzed as well. Finally towards the end there’s some credit given for staying in the game as well as a look ahead to the league cup tie in midweek. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon to see us on the video recording patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 405 - What Is Fair To Expect

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s to take a different approach towards discussing Arsenal’s win over Leicester in the League Cup. The entire episode is a conversation about the performances and status of four players; Joe Willock, Reiss Nelson, Nicolas Pepe and Ainsley Maitland-Niles. The players are discussed in the context of their performance in midweek and where they go from there. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon to see us on the video recording patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 404 - A Conversation About Four Players

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s win over West Ham. There’s debates about the lineup and inclusion of Kolasinac, along with a discussion of what went wrong with the midfield play. There’s also individual analysis of several players including the midfielders, Lacazette, Willian, Saka, Kola and the central defense. The group also discusses the substitution strategy and influence of the subs. Finally the pod takes a moment to celebrate a hard fought win and discuss where this leaves the team heading into a tricky period. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon to see us on the video recording patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

itunes.summary:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s win over West Ham. There’s debates about the lineup and inclusion of Kolasinac, along with a discussion of what went wrong with the midfield play. There’s also individual analysis of several players including the midfielders, Lacazette, Willian, Saka, Kola and the central defense. The group also discusses the substitution strategy and influence of the subs. Finally the pod takes a moment to celebrate a hard fought win and discuss where this leaves the team heading into a tricky period. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 403 - Do Plan A

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s transfer business and the Aubameyang re-signing. The pod opens with a discussion about what Arsenal plan to do with the Emi Martinez money, namely buying all the goalkeepers. That turns into an unexpected argument with some terrible analogies. Then the conversation turns to midfield signings and how we might wind up with both Partey and Aouar. Finally, there’s a discussion about Aubameyang becoming an Arsenal legend before a quick look ahead to West Ham at The Weekend. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Signup for our Patreon at patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 402 - Two More Refrigerators

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s comfortable 3-0 win over Fulham in the opening game of the new season. The pod opens with a discussion about the lineup and the opening moment for Leno to remind everyone that he’s a pretty good Keeper in his own right. Then there’s praise for Willian and a discussion of his role on the right and the ramifications for that going forward. Then the group has a long discussion about patterns of play and the developing style under Arteta. There’s praise for Hector Bellerin and some discussion of a few other players who stood out including Gabriel’s debut performance. Finally the group spends some time debating the value of beating a bad Fulham side as well as the importance of having a set piece coach. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon to see us on the video recording patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 401 - The Quintuple Is Still On

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arteta’s first press conference as “manager” and look ahead to the Fulham game that kicks off the new season. Just prior to that, for about 5 minutes, Mike (@goonersvcancer) comes on the pod to discuss goonersvcancer.com. After that, the football conversation starts with a debate about Arteta’s new role and how it impacts Edu. Then the transfer rumors are discussed with a focus mostly on outgoings in light of the manager’s comments. The the group tries to pick a lineup and score for the game. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon to see us on the video recording patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to finish predictions for the 2020-2021 season. After the break, Mark Thompson from 23 Sport joins the pod to give his scouting report of Gabriel (43:00). All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 397 - Skip The First Section

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the gargantuan Community Shield and then take listener questions. After analyzing the win over Liverpool the group gets into the questions and a lot of them focus on AMN, Emi Martinez and what the club will do in the transfer window. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 396 - A Trophy After Every Game

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss whether Matteo Guendouzi has a way back at Arsenal, the startlingly poor state of the midfield, some of the best midfield transfer rumors, Emi Martinez’s possible impending departure, coaching additions and the community shield. Then Mike (@thegoonerspod) joins to discuss the important charity fundraiser goonersvscancer.com. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 394 - Bye Bye Birdie Catcher

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the announcement that Raul has left the club and all the possible reasons for the decision and the ramifications for the club, Edu and this transfer window. Then the group discusses the strong links to the young defender Gabriel, before finishing with a brief conversation about Aubameyang potentially being on the verge of resigning for Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 393 - The 56th Redundancy

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by James Benge (@jamesbenge) to discuss Willian’s arrival, the sensibility of the deal and what he will provide on the pitch. Then they touch on some internal investigations within the club and the Ozil interview. After the break (44:45) Paul (@poznaninmypants) gives his thoughts on Willian and wether there are concerns about the way the club is doing its transfer business. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 392 - He Looks Good In The Shirt

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to answer listener questions! There are questions about the academy kids, formations for next season, the goal keeping situation, and of course transfers, transfers and more transfers. After the break (36:00) Ted Knutson (@mixedknuts) from Stats Bomb comes on the pod for a brilliant discussion of squad building and an analysis of the current situation at Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 391 - Mailbag and Squad Building

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the club statement about the redundancies. That discussion touches on issues of leadership at the club and of course the ownership, as well as the 12.5% pay cut the players took just a few months ago. Then the conversation focuses on the departure of 2 scouts and what it means about player recruitment at the club. Then Clive and Elliot take on the Willian rumors. After that, Scott (@oh_that_crab) joins the pod to discuss the Willian rumor specifically and what Mikel Arteta might do with Willian in the squad. (65:00) All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the club statement about the redundancies. That discussion touches on issues of leadership at the club and of course the ownership, as well as the 12.5% pay cut the players took just a few months ago. Then the conversation focuses on the departure of 2 scouts and what it means about player recruitment at the club. Then Clive and Elliot take on the Willian rumors. After that, Scott (@oh_that_crab) joins the pod to discuss the Willian rumor specifically and what Mikel Arteta might do with Willian in the squad. (65:00) All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to celebrate Arsenal’s FA Cup Final victory! There’s some early praise for Arteta and discussion of what the win means before a detailed analysis of the game and player performances. There’s laughter at rivals and a look ahead to what comes next for Mikel Arteta’s Arsenal. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 389 - FA Cup Final - The Arsenal FC Cup

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the impending Cup Final against Chelsea. The group takes on the question of lineups and formations, where the danger comes from for both teams, and what to make of the threat posed by Olivier Giroud. There’s some debate about who the key players will be and whether the entire game comes down to what happens on the wings. There are predictions and some discussion of what’s on the line. Come on Arsenal! All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 388 - Cup Final Preview

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a silly final game of the season that saw Watford hilariously relegated and Mike Dean made unhappy by VAR. The game is discussed with an eye towards the cup final and how Arteta should line Arsenal up against Chelsea. There are some debates about Joe Willock and Rob Holding plus questions about whether Saka will start at the weekend. There’s praise for Ceballos and even a Sokratis mention. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 387 - Watford (h) - Thank God It’s Over

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss a drab loss at Aston Villa. Actually, they try to discuss anything but that performance. After questioning a few performances and the setup overall, the group tries to answer the question of how Arteta can get this group to dominate small teams more easily and create more chances. After that discussion and a focus on the midfield, there’s a look ahead to the FA Cup Final. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 386 - Aston Villa (a) - Let’s Talk About Something Else

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a fantastic performance and massive result against City in the FA cup semifinal. The pod takes the time to praise almost every player for individually excellent performances while stopping along the way to comment on the passages of play that defined the game, including the fantastic playing out from the back. The final segment of the episode is reserved for praising Arteta and looking ahead briefly to the Cup Final. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 385 - FA Cup Semifinal - Big Boy Football

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an amusing if unexpected win over Liverpool at the Emirates. The group starts by focusing on what went right before digging a little deeper into the performance, tactics, and where we lost control of the game. There’s praise for Lacazette. Then there’s a discussion of how the defense performed including a discussion of Emi Martinez and whether a goal-keeper should be sold. After the game is fully discussed, there’s a long section on Arteta’s post match comments. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

The group starts by focusing on what went right before digging a little deeper into the performance, tactics, and where we lost control of the game. There’s praise for Lacazette. Then there’s a discussion of how the defense performed including a discussion of Emi Martinez and whether a goal-keeper should be sold. After the game is fully discussed, there’s a long section on Arteta’s post match comments. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast 
 See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 384 - Liverpool (h) - Parkour

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to a horrific self-inflicted defeat in the North London Derby. There’s a discussion about the technical level in the squad and why we are playing three terrible central defenders all at once. The group tries to examine why Arsenal failed to capitalize on periods of dominance and the causes of the errors that lost the game. There’s questions about players at nearly every position and the substitutions that failed to have the desired effect. Arteta’s tactics are explored and there’s a debate about prioritizing defense over attack. Ultimately there are questions about how to make the most out of a desperately poor squad and what to prioritize in the remaining league matches. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 383 - Spurs (a) - Arsenal Beat Arsenal

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an encouraging but ultimately disappointing draw to Leicester. The episode starts with a discussion of refereeing, the Vardy kick on Mustafi, whether Arsenal have been unfairly treated by refs, and how Arteta responded. Then the game analysis starts with praise for Dani Ceballos and a discussion of Arsenal’s midfield needs in general. There’s even praise for Kolasinac. After that Lacazette’s performance is addressed for the highs and lows. There’s a discussion of the way Arsenal played down to ten men and the perofmrnaues of the substitutes and a nice discussion of the positives that can be taken out of the performance. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 382 - Leicester (h) - All The VAR Refs Are Mike Dean

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a big win at Wolves. Up for discussion is the battling nature of the win starting with thoughts on the lineup and how we dealt with Adama Traore. There’s a discussion of the good work and shortcomings of the midfield, as well as Saka’s struggles on the right but ability to win the game with a moment of brilliance. There’s a section on Tierney and how his performance was influenced by having Kolasinac on his right. Then the group discusses Arteta’s use of the drinks break for coaching purposes and the fantastic impact all of his subs made in the game. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 381 - Wolves (a) - Arteta Is Improving

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a fun win over Norwich City. It may not have been the most difficult opposition but that doesn’t stop the group from enjoying the performance and celebrating the players who thrived, including a special debut cameo for Cedric Soares. There’s also some discussion of the new Saka deal and the future of one Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 380 - Norwich City (h) - Ignore The Damn Crapatron

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the win over Sheffield United in the FA Cup. There’s a big initial discussion about the interesting formation and the way the system operated. Then the conversation focuses on a few performances including Willock, Pepe and Lacazette. There’s some discussion about rebuilding the midfield and Arsenal's issues on set piece. At the end of the pod the group discusses the latest Matteo Guendouzi news. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 379 - Sheffield United (a)  - Our Name Is On The Cup

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an actual win at Southampton. First the group discusses the lineup and how the formation looked in different phases of buildup with and without the ball. Then the conversation moves to the pattern o play and Arsenal’s insistence on using the wings and eschewing the center of the pitch. That leads into discussions of individual performances including Saka, Auba, Pepe, Bellerin, Xhaka and Ceballos. There’s also praise for Holding and Martinez. At the end of the pod the group debates what to do about Matteo Guendouzi. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 378 - Southampton (a)  - Bouncing Off The Bottom

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by everyone! Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants), Tim (@stillberto) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss a game against City that felt comfortingly and frustratingly familiar. Topics include the lineup, talent gap, some worrying individual performances, Luiz’s disaster class, Ozil and the problem with players on their way out of the club playing for us now. We also look forward to the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 376 - City (a)  - Like It Never Left

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an actual Mikel Arteta press conference. Naturally a huge amount of focus is spent on the Aubameyang situation and Arteta’s comments about the contract negotiations. After a long Auba debate, including whether we should sell or keep, the discussion moves on to Saka, and what will happen with his contract situation. There’s some discussion of Nketiah, and a quick look ahead to the City game. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 375 - We Are Trying

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is … gone… Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) we discussed Steve Round’s interview and talked about the culture and behaviors Arteta is trying to instill. Then they moved onto the more technical aspects of the coaching as described by Steve Round and talked about whether there is a risk of disconnect between the coaches / players and the executive level of the club. They discussed the ‘contacts book’ approach of Raul and the pros and cons of being in with the super agents and attracting more local talent from London into the academy. They closed out by talking about Pepe and how his finish to the season might look. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 374  - The Grass Is Green And The Ball Is Round

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the announced fixtures and schedule. The group discusses what to expect from a squad standpoint with so many fixtures in such a short period of time and how the substitution rule will impact tactics. There’s an analysis of the Top 6 situation and how it will shake out. Lastly, the group covers a few of the latest transfer rumors. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!

Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 373  - Someone Please Think Of The Podcasters

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the impending return of actual football. After a brief mention of the current events in the news, there’s a debate about whether anyone is ready for football to be back, whether it makes sense, and what it will mean when it kicks off. There’s a discussion of the excitement for the individual competitions and what to expect from the team including which players will benefit most and which players will suffer. There’s a look ahead to the future of the squad, and a discussion about resigning Saka and Luiz as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

itunes.summary:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the impending return of actual football. After a brief mention of the current events in the news, there’s a debate about whether anyone is ready for football to be back, whether it makes sense, and what it will mean when it kicks off. There’s a discussion of the excitement for the individual competitions and what to expect from the team including which players will benefit most and which players will suffer. There’s a look ahead to the future of the squad, and a discussion about resigning Saka and Luiz as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!

items.title: Episode 372 - The Misery Returns

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Kroenke Sports and Entertainment’s ownership of Arsenal is discussed and debated. First Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Matt (@giantgooner) for a forensic financial analysis of KSE. First they discuss the circumstances surrounding the acquisition of the club, and then they explore KSE’s ability to fund the club for success. After that, Elliot is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to cover all the bases regarding the owner. They explore how it felt when he first arrived and the early ownership period. Then they debate the idea of a self-sustaining model, whether Arsenal can succeed under KSE and what makes a good owner in modern football. There’s plenty of debate about mistakes that have been made and a final discussion about how long KSE will stick around. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 370  - Welcome to the Wild Wild West

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to announce our JustGiving campaign for The Arsenal Foundation, and then to discuss the future of football. This is a long conversation first about how football moves forward, but then, principally, if football as we know it will change forever, including the possible start of a European super league and possible elimination of promotion and relegation. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!
GIVE BACK! Donate to the Arsenal foundation with us here: https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to relive the highs and lows of a very special and at times, very painful season at Arsenal. They cover the new players, changes at the club, high points, low points and controversies that surrounded a season that could’ve been so much more special. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Mesut Ozil’s situation with the wage deduction. The two debate what the players should be asked to do, what Ozil’s response means, what his agent had to say, and whether this will have repercussions for re-signing the young players at the club. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!

The two debate what the players should be asked to do, what Ozil’s response means, what his agent had to say, and whether this will have repercussions for re-signing the young players at the club. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

items.title: Episode 366 - The Ozil In The Coal Mine

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss when football might come back. There's a brief Alex Iwobi discussion you won't have expected and then the future of football is examined. Then after a good chat about that there is a long and healthy, but heated, debate about the players being asked to give back some of their wages. It gets pretty fiery at times but ultimately ends cordially and hopefully you enjoy it. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss actual football stuff. This is a good, flowing conversation about the impact of the pandemic on the business of football, the way it will change Arsenal’s squad building approach, and what players might be most affected in the long term. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Stay safe everyone!

items.title: Episode 362 - Emirates Era Player Draft

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to attempt to build the perfect footballer. Using only players from the Emirates era, they choose one player for each attribute including left-foot shot, right-foot shot, finishing, vision, first touch, pace, and more. Each player can only be used for one category making it a bit trickier! You can build your perfect player by visiting the website here https://www.arsenalvisionpodcast.com/build-a-player
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 361 - Build The Perfect Player

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the news that Jaeson Rosenfeld, the head of StatDNA, is leaving the club to join Arsene Wenger at FIFA. This is a long debate that discusses the role of analytics at the club, how they should or could be used, whether this is a move that could be problematic going forward, and what the expectations could be for the use of analytics in the future at Arsenal. Towards the end of the pod there’s a discussion about how the role of football in our lives might change after the pandemic is over. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Arsenal DNA or StatsDNA

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to crown a champion in the tournament of the greatest players in the Emirates era at Arsenal. There are some controversial exclusions and inclusions and of course, some huge upsets along the way. Listen along as we choose a winner from each matchup, then head to our website and vote. https://www.arsenalvisionpodcast.com/player-eliminator
We’ll release the results later this week. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Signup for our Patreon and join the community patreon.com/arsenalvisionpodcast

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to cover the incredible developments around the world as Covid-19 shuts down football. First the group expresses concern and best wishes for Mikel Arteta, and then dives into the ramifications for Arsenal and the football season generally. There’s a fun proposal for sorting out the Champions League places. Lastly, the group wonders about the lasting impact for football and Arsenal specifically. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to cover the ugly and beautiful win over West Ham. There’s an early discussion of the right back situation and Sokratis starting ahead of AMN. Then the discussion turns to midfield and the problems with ball progression and chance creation. There’s a long debate about Pablo Mari, Mikel Arteta’s substitutions, and a discussion about the changing nature of Premier League football. Lastly the group attempts to answer the question of whether Aubameyang should be played through the middle. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 357 - West Ham (h) - All Wins Are Beautiful

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to cover the straightforward win at Portsmouth in the FA Cup. Although the game was relatively uneventful, there were some good performances to cover. Rather than going moment but moment, the group took the opportunity to analyze individual performances one at a time, focusing on the young players and of course, debutante Pablo Mari. At the end of the pod, the group wonders where a team of all academy players could finish in the Premier League. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to cover the gutting elimination from the Europa League at home to Olympiacos. The conversation starts at the end with questions about why Arsenal seem to have a unique ability to choke under pressure. Then there’s a discussion about how much responsibility should be laid at the feet of Mikel Arteta. After covering the devastation of the end of the match the pod goes back to the beginning with a discussion of a lackadaisical first half and why Arsenal lacked urgency. Finally there’s in depth analysis of a few disappointing performances before the pod ends with questions about how the elimination will impact the team going forward. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 355 - Olympiacos (h) - Did That Really Happen?

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss a third consecutive win for Arsenal at home to Everton. As usual, the crew debates the lineup decisions and tries to explain the defending for Everton’s first goal. There’s praise for the performance in the first half offensively, and concerns about how the left-back situation will be managed in the absence of Kolasinac and Tierney. Aubameyang gets his well deserved kudos for a captain’s performance and there’s extra attention paid to the back line and goal keeper. After discussing a few more performances and the extent to which fatigue was responsible for a weaker second half, the group looks ahead and wonders if the Premier League can still provide a route to Champions League qualification. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 354 - Everton (h) - Ncouraging

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is absent meaning Paul (@poznaninmypants) rotates in to the host duties joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss an away win at difficult to beat Olympiacos in the first leg of the Europa League knockout tie. Presumably they talked about the lineup, Arteta’s decision to start Leno, Joe Willock’s performance, Saka continuing to star at left-back, Lacazette’s winning goal and overall form, the continued redemption arc for Mustafi and few other bits and bobs. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 353 - Olympiacos (a) - Beware of Greeks

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss an actual win in the Premier League. The conversation focuses on the star performances against Newcastle including Saka, Ozil, Ceballos and Pepe. There’s a discussion about the interesting lineup, and why Eddie might’ve been handed the start. Then the group breaks down how the formation helped Saka and maybe provided Pepe a slightly different opportunity. Arteta’s man management and substitutions come into focus as well. At the end there’s talk of Guendouzi’s disciplinary issue, whether 5th place in the PL is a possibility now that it comes with a CL place, and what to expect for the first leg at Olympiacos on Thursday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 352 - Newcastle (h) - All Good Things

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Scott (oh_that_crab), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to engage in the podcast’s second ever “would you rather” episode. Everyone gets a chance to answer a series of difficult questions that posit a variety of challenging scenarios. There are questions about selling Auba, who to play up front the rest of the season, choosing league or cup glory, changing transfer moves or managerial selections from the past, how to focus on the rest of the season, whether to emphasis attack or defense, and some additional silliness. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 351 - Would You Rather 2

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s 400th draw of the season at Burnley. They discuss the good start and subsequent deterioration of the performance. There’s analysis of the change in the game when Saka came off, the struggles up front, Martinelli on the right, and the decision not to use Pepe. There’s some praise for Mustafi and some questions about the midfield. Finally there’s a bit of a discussion about Arteta’s substations, the AMN absence and the Cedric loan. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 350 - Burnley (a) - Burnley Boo Barn

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s FA Cup victory over Bournemouth. Naturally this episode focuses heavily on the performances of the academy kids, specifically, Willock and Saka. There’s also praise for Guendouzi as a man of the match candidate. The group celebrates a great goal and how Arteta’s system is putting players in positions to thrive. At the end, there’s a question about transfers in the wake of Mustafi’s injury. After the break, Amy Lawrence (@amylawrence71) joins to talk about the academy and transfers. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 349 - Bournemouth (a) - Our Cup Runneth Over

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s draw at Stamford Bridge. The pod starts out dissecting the slow start to the game for Arsenal before sadly having to discuss another Mustafi error that badly cost his team. Then there’s praise for Arteta managing the side while down to ten men and making the decision to leave his attackers on the pitch. Finally there’s time to celebrate the highlight moment of the game with a discussion of Martinelli’s goal and the future for this budding superstar. There’s praise for Saka and Xhaka and finally some time to enjoy the captain’s goal from Bellerin and an overall encouraging performance from him. Lastly, the group asks what the result means for the team. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

Then there’s praise for Arteta managing the side while down to ten men and making the decision to leave his attackers on the pitch. Finally there’s time to celebrate the highlight moment of the game with a discussion of Martinelli’s goal and the future for this budding superstar. There’s praise for Saka and Xhaka and finally some time to enjoy the captain’s goal from Bellerin and an overall encouraging performance from him. Lastly, the group asks what the result means for the team. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 348 - Chelsea (a) - Golden God

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s draw at home to Sheffield United. This is a great discussion about a performance that divided opinion. It starts with an examination of our early struggles and continues with a focus on how we can get the attack improving. There’s specific focus on Lacazette and the “Ozil role.” Then there’s a detailed discussion of performances from Pepe and the fabulous Martinelli. After debating the penalty that Mike Dean failed to award and the late substitutions, the pod ends with an evaluation of Areteta’s work so far. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s draw at Crystal Palace. The group covers the strong opening period but lack of cutting edge, the drop off in possession, the red card, poor refereeing, final period of the game down to 10 men, and what to do without Aubameyang going forward. A big segment of this episode focuses on the midfield and Arsenal’s problems progressing the ball, along with the usual break down of individual performances. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 346 - Palace (a) - E-Wing Theory

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s win over Leeds in the FA Cup. The pod starts with an examination of what went wrong in the first half. There’s a focus on the passing out from the back and play in midfield. Eventually, the group examines what went right in the second half, along with discussing several individual performances including Xhaka, Guendouzi, Lacazette, Pepe and Sokratis. Finally, there’s praise for Arteta’s ability to correct things in the dressing room at halftime. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 345 - Leeds (h) - A Game of Two 45 Minute Segments

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s phenomenal start to the new decade with a win over United. The pod starts by exploring the good feeling around the club then turns attention to Pepe and the difference he made in the first half. There’s a detailed analysis of all the players who have been lifted by Arteta, with specific emphasis on Ozil, Xhaka and AMN. There are also sections on Lacazette and Luiz. Then the group moves through the key moments of the game, the way it finished, the celebrations at the end and what the future holds for this team as a group and whether January might see some exits. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Have a very happy New Year!

items.title: Episode 344 - United (h) - The Fun Is Back

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s heartbreaking loss to Chelsea. The group discusses the lineup and opening period that saw Arsenal dominate and take the lead. There’s a break down of several individual performances including Ozil, Torreira, Lacazette, Guendouzi, and Aubameyang. The pod explores how the game changes when Chelsea switched to a back four and questions the prevailing narrative about Arteta being out-coached. Theres a debate about the substitutions a discussion of fitness and questions about how Arteta deals with this squad going forward. Lastly, there’s a look ahead to the United game on New Year’s Day. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. Have a very happy New Year!

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s draw at Bournemouth in Arteta’s first game in charge. The group discusses the fascinating tactical approach and specifically how it impacted AMN, Xhaka and Saka’s roles. There’s a discussion of Ozil’s excellent first half and the improvement in the way the ball was played in central spaces. Xhaka’s performance comes in for praise, as does Torreira’s. Then the group looks at how the forward line failed to take advantage of excellent positions before examining the substitutions. Lastly, there’s a look ahead to the Chelsea game on Sunday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 342 - Bournemouth (a) - Football Is Back

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s nil-nil draw at Everton. The group debates and discusses the lineup and whether it was influenced at all by Mikel Arteta. There’s a conversation about Smith Rowe’s performance and how to best develop the bevy of talented academy players currently at the club. Then the group wonders about Freddie’s substitutions and especially the players he didn’t bring on and whether he needed to be more aggressive in going for the three points towards the end of the game. After the match analysis concludes there’s a look ahead to what Arteta will try to instill in his first few games and questions about Aubameyang’s future at the club. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 341 - Everton (a) - Top 4 Is Lava

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Clive (@clivepafc) and eventually Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the introduction of Mikel Arteta as Arsenal head coach. There’s the emotional reaction to his arrival, an analysis of his first interviews, and a debate about what he brings to the club and whether his lack of experience is an issue. Then the group discusses his possible tactical approach, how to evaluate him over the next few months and what players will thrive or fall away from the team with Arteta in charge. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 340 - Artetaaaaaaaa

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) opens the show with some quick thoughts about the big Arsenal news and of course promos, and then gives way to Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the lost at home to City, the happenings around that game, the Europa League draw, but most of all, the news that Mikel Arteta may finally be taking over the role of Arsenal head coach. It’s a jam packed episode and no Elliot to interrupt. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 339 - City (h) - Longest Interview Ever

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) opens the show with an announcement then gives was to Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss the draw that improbably secured the top spot in Arsenal’s Europa League group. There’s a discussion of the lineup, some player performances and what the future holds for Arsenal in this competition. Then there’s a look ahead to Manchester City at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the desperately needed win at West Ham. The pod starts with a breakdown of the three goals and that leads into a further discussion of the front three and whether Freddie has finally stumbled onto a bit of a solution for how to setup the team. There’s analysis of the individual performances and some debate about what went wrong in the first half. Finally, there’s a bit of a look ahead as Arsenal try to build on this win. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 337 - West Ham (a) - Easy As One Two Three

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the importance of coaching and the actual quality of the squad in the wake of a horrible loss at Brighton. The conversation covers the larger issues plaguing the club with a bit of detail on the game itself. Finally, the group debates how to approach the rest of the season with the league season seemingly lost. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 336 - Brighton (h) - Parachute Payments

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the dawn of the Freddie Ljungberg era. The conversation starts with a discussion about the right timeline for evaluating the new coach before examining some of his team selection decisions. The group compares and contrasts the performances in the first and second half against Norwich and wonders about the quality of the squad. Some specific player performances are dissected before the discussion turns to the speculation about the next Arsenal manager. Then Elliot is joined by Stadio Podcast co-host Ryan Hunn (@ryanhunn) to discuss Arsenal's search for the next manager. The conversation starts with Ryan talking about his interview with Ian Wright. Then they move on to exploring the start of the Freddie era, how long it might last, what the expectations should be, how the next manager should be selected, the role the Europa League will play, and ultimately who Ryan fervently believes will get the job. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Vote for your favorite Pod member when you sign up for the athletic and get 50% off and a month free!

items.title: Episode 335 - Norwich (a) - Are We The Baddies

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Unai Emery’s sacking from the position of Arsenal Head Coach. The conversation starts with a bit about the decision and the game that made it inevitable. Then there’s a conversation about what the timing of the decision says about Raul. There’s a discussion about what Freddy can do with his time in charge in the short term before the pod wraps up with a discussion about who should be hired as the next Head Coach and how that decisions should be made. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

The conversation starts with a bit about the decision and the game that made it inevitable. Then there’s a conversation about what the timing of the decision says about Raul. There’s a discussion about what Freddy can do with his time in charge in the short term before the pod wraps up with a discussion about who should be hired as the next Head Coach and how that decisions should be made. items.title: Episode 334 - Frankfurt (h) - The Perfect Birthday Present

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss another Unai Emery disasterclass. The conversation includes all the fun topics like; the back three, the diabolical defending, the miserable shot totals, the “best 20 minutes of the season,” the late siege on the Arsenal goal, and the equalizer no one wanted. Then there are shots fired at Raul and company. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 333 - Southampton (h) - Where’s The Bottom

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the Poch sacking and Jose hiring. After taking on the topic from all angles, the group explores what it means for Arsenal. Then the conversation moves on the player unrest. First there’s a discussion of the Torreira comments and what it means for his future at the club, then the same questions are asked about Xhaka in light of his comments. The pod ends with a look ahead to four easy fixtures and then the brutal run that follows. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 332 - The Doomsday Scenario

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, a repost of last week’s Patreon episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the role fans play in supporting the team through thick and thin. With some of the statements coming out of the club the two explore the question of what fans should be doing to support the club or express their displeasure. There’s a discussion about reporting and how journalists communicate club messages to the fans. And of course there’s some discussion of Emery’s future and what it says about Raul and the backroom staff generally. Then Lewis Ambrose (@lgambrose) joins the pod to discuss the situation surrounding Aubameyang in the wake of some controversy about his associations and reporting about problems in the dressing room. There’s also a discussion about the role of fan produced content with an emphasis on AFTV. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 331 - Gaslight Nation

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Andrew (@arseblog) to discuss another disappointing result at Leicester. The pod starts out with some basic reaction to the game plan at the King Power stadium and questions about whether Arsenal should be approaching a game at Leicester in that manner. There’s a bit of tactical discussion and talk about the substitutions, before the attention turns squarely to the head coach and whether he can possibly remain in charge. After focusing on Emery, the pod attempts to answer whether Raul Sanllehi and Edu have things under control and what to make of the noises coming out of the club that seem to suggest Emery is staying and potentially point a finger at the fans as a part of the problem. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 330 - Leicester (a) - Vote Of Confidence

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a wet and dreary evening in Portugal. They cover the abysmal return of the back 3, worries about how the young players are coping and speculation about when Emery’s time at Arsenal could be up. After the break Rob Tanner (@RobTannerLCFC) the Leicester reporter for the Athletic, joins Elliot to discuss Brendan Rodger’s success at Leicester, what has worked for the Foxes so far this season, and what Arsenal can expect from the match on Saturday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 329 - Vitoria (a) - November Rain

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss another disappointing home draw to Wolves. The discussion naturally starts with an emphasis on the formation, the selection of Mesut Ozil, and non-selection of Nicolas Pepe. The group debates what worked and what didn’t with special attention paid to Lucas Torreira’s bizarre role and Calum Chambers’ limitations. There’s a section on the substitutes and a question about top 4 chances. Finally, the group debates whether there’s any reason to wait on sacking Emery and what to make of Jose Mourinho rumors. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 328 - Wolves (h) - Pepe Le Bench

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Football London reporter James Benge (@jamesbenge) to discuss the exciting but ultimately disappointing Carabao Cup tie at Anfield. First they discuss the Ozil situation, his performance and what happens next. Next, there’s a similar examination of Lucas Torreira’s situation. The conversation moves on to other individual performances and Gabriel Martinelli in particular. Towards the end of the discussion, James focuses in on Emery’s conservative tendencies, his tenability to continue as Arsenal coach, and what happens next with the Xhaka situation. After the break Paul (@poznaninmypants) joins to discuss the highest and lows from the match and what to expect at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 327 - LFC (a) - Plus Ça Change

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the quite remarkable scenes at the Emirates during the disappointing draw with Crystal Palace. The first half of the pod is a long discussion about the Xhaka substitution, the booing, and the player’s reaction. There’s a further discussion bout what it means for the player before that turns into a discussion about what it means for Unai Emery. Then there’s analysis of David Ornstein’s reporting regarding support for Emery at the club and the managerial candidates the club considered before hiring Emery. There’s a bit of a discussion about the 442 formation from the game and a look ahead to the Liverpool cup tie. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 326 - Palace (h) - No Turning Back

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the a variety of topics surrounding the win over Vitoria. The pod starts with the now tedious but still relevant Ozil debate including a discussion of Emery’s comments and Ozil’s social media shenanigans, plus a bit on Emery’s pre-match comments concerning his progress with the team. The discussion moves on to individual performances including AMN and Willock, and the decision to substitute them at halftime. Eventually the pod has time to celebrate Pepe’s goals and discuss what it could mean for him going forward before ending with a bit of praise for Martinelli and even a question about Jose Mourinho attending the match with Raul. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 325 - Vitoria (h) - Pepe To The Rescue

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the disappointing loss at Sheffield United. The conversation begins with questions about the selection, most notably the decision to leave out Tierney. Then there’s a long discussion about Arsenal’s struggles with ball progression, and how the midfield contributes to the problem. There’s a nuanced analysis of Pepe’s performance before the talk turns to the substitutions, and the Manager’s head scratching reaction to the game. After the break Tim (@stillberto) joins Elliot to discuss what the result means for Emery and where the club go from here. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 324 - Sheffield United (a) - The Pitchforks Are Coming Out

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss David Ornstein’s interview with Mesut Ozil. There’s a discussion about the importance of training well, whether the message from Emery changed due to a change in behavior or as a response to the interview, what to expect from Ozil going forward and whether he has a point about ‘big games.’ Elliot reveals that he’ll read whatever is in the Skype chat. Then the conversation moves to the game on Monday and the impact of getting Tierney, Bellerin and possibly Lacazette back and what it means for our tactical approach. There’s a debate about whether Emery has to prove himself between now and Christmas, and finally some predictions about the result on Monday. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 323 - My Wombat Is Constipated

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a challenging performance but encouraging result. This pod attempts to examine the flaws in the performance while taking the time to appreciate what went well and the importance of the result. There’s a detailed look at the flaws in midfield the problem of playing without natural fullbacks. There’s praise for Chambers and questions about his role going forward. Then there’s a discussion about Pepe and whether he’s doing more than maybe we realize. The group looks ahead and wonders whether there might be cause for the performances to improve but questions what went wrong in a dire second half. Lastly, there’s time to laugh at the misfortune of our rivals. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 322 - Bournemouth (h) - Eye of the Beholder

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss a really enjoyable win in the Europa League. The pod starts with emphatic praise for Martinelli and his star-making performance. There’s a detailed discussion of the midfield and how it benefitted both Ceballos and Torreira. Naturally there’s excitement over the return of the fullbacks and specifically the performance of Tierney. Then the group works through various individual performances including Willock, Nelson, and AMN. There’s a little question about Pepe and the other subs before the pod tries to answer the question of whether this performance and approach can translate to the Premier League. Lastly, there’s a tiny bit of Oil discussion. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 321 - Standard (h) - Martinaldo

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss an ugly game of football at Old Trafford. The debate gets spirited early with disagreement about our tactics and Emery’s conservatism and the group wonders why the set pieces are so poor. There’s a discussion of the approach that leads into individual performances, starting with Xhaka. Then there’s time for praise, specifically for Guendouzi and Saka as well. There’s a debate about the substitutions, some discussion of Ozil, and thoughts on whether a point is a good result. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
