items.title: Episode 320 - United (a) - Tough To Watch

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a busy week in the world of Arsenal. The pod starts with a discussion about the captaincy, before moving on to cover the fun Forest game and huge upcoming Premier League match at Old Trafford. Questions are asked and answered about Emery’s approach to selecting the captains and the players who were ultimately named. Praise is heaped on the young players who shined in the League Cup. There’s a celebratory nod to the return of three influential defenders and recognition for Calum Chambers. Unfortunately, there’s also a discussion of the continuing Mesut Ozil saga. Lastly, there’s a look ahead to the match against a very vulnerable United and whether this could be the chance to finally win a league match at Old Trafford. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

Questions are asked and answered about Emery’s approach to selecting the captains and the players who were ultimately named. Praise is heaped on the young players who shined in the League Cup. There’s a celebratory nod to the return of three influential defenders and recognition for Calum Chambers. Unfortunately, there’s also a discussion of the continuing Mesut Ozil saga. Lastly, there’s a look ahead to the match against a very vulnerable United and whether this could be the chance to finally win a league match at Old Trafford. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 319 - Forest (h) - Oh Captains, My Captains

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the incredible comeback victory over Aston Villa. The podcast is forced to start with the negative, asking questions about Arsenal’s early match struggles. There’s obviously a focus on the coach as well as the performances of the AMN, the center-backs, Xhaka and Ceballos, plus a quick take on how Saka looked in his first league start. As the tone shifts towards the comeback, there’s enthusiasm for Guendouzi’s performance and some credit given to Chambers as well. There’s also a look at the value of this win in the context of the other results this weekend All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 318 - Villa (h) - Nothing Makes Sense

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) to discuss an odd but ultimately satisfying victory at Frankfurt in the Europa League. The conversation starts with a discussion of the team selection and whether it was right to risk Aubameyang and not bring Ozil. After that, there’s an effort to make sense of why this system is leading to such open, back and forth football and what can be done to get more control of games. There’s praise for Willock and Martinez, as well as questions about how Lucas Torreira is being used. Towards the end of the pod there’s plenty of celebration over Bukaya Saka as well as a mention for Pepe. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 317 - Frankfurt (a) - Saka’s Got It

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to pick the bones out of a dispiriting draw at Vicarage road. The conversation starts with some thoughts about the start of the game and the level of intensity from both sides. There’s some questions about the individual performances and recurring theme of individual errors and a litany of awful stats to back up the concern. Then the conversation shifts mostly to the head coach, his tactics, his substitutions, the issues he’s having finding an effective approach, whether his message is getting through, and where the club goes from here. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 316 - Watford (a) - That Old Familiar Feeling

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by two very special guests. First up is Michael Cox (@zonal_marking) to discuss his article in the Athletic about Lacazette attempting to ape the false 9 role played by Firmino and how Arsenal can try to get the powerful front three clicking this season. Michael gives his appraisal of Emery’s football and what he expects from Arsenal this season. Then special guest number two, Jame McNicholas (@gunnerblog) comes on the give his perspective on what the sales of Iwobi and loan of Mkhitaryan means for the future of the front 3 and how the young players waiting in the wings could make a difference on the wing. (Pun!) Finally, Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) join to discuss the importance of the next 12 games, dubbed #project36. The group discusses how Arsenal might come through that run of fixtures before providing a brief preview of Arsenal’s trip to Watford at the weekend. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
Get the athletic for 2.50 a month and help the pod by signing up at theathletic.com/arsenalvision.

items.title: Episode 315 - The One With Two Guests

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to give their take on the highs and lows of the North London Derby. Naturally Xhaka’s performance is in the spotlight from the beginning and the group wonders about his selection and future in the team. The tactical issues with the first half are examined as well as the litany of errors for the first goal. Then the discussion focuses on the good and bad of the big 3 up front. There’s huge praise for Guendouzi and questions about Torreira’s deployment. The substitutions are discussed as are both goals, and there’s a bit on Mkhitaryan as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 313 - Tottenham (h) - The Stars Are Aligning Too Much

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to look back on the loss at Anfield. After briefly discussing the lineup, there’s a very long and detailed debate about the tactics. The group discusses the wisdom of the approach, what worked and what didn’t, and why the changes didn’t come sooner. There’s praise for Pepe and some criticism for one or two others, plus a quick break to take stock of our place in the league. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 311 - Liverpool (a) - Match Preview

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the home win over Burnley and the masterful full-debut from Dani Ceballos. The pod opens with praise for the midfield maestro and analysis of how he made a difference to the way the midfield played. After all the praise for Ceballos the conversation focuses on other individual performances like Joe Willock and Matteo Guendouzi. There’s a discussion of the forward play and some of the missed opportunities, as well as an analysis of Emery’s subs and the switch to the back 3 late in the game. The crew examines Pepe’s 45 minutes and looks ahead to Liverpool. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 310 - Burnley (h) - Oh Dani Ceballos

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to break down the opening day win at a very wet St. James’ Park. There’s a discussion of the youthful lineup and great performances from Guendouzi, AMN, and Aubameyang as well as a bit of perspective on the way Mkhitaryian and Xhaka played. There are a few questions asked and answered about Joe Willock’s performance as well as a discussion about the substitutes. Later in the pod, Scott (@oh_that_crab) joins to give a statistical breakdown of the match including those who shined and those who underwhelmed. There’s even a bit of a laugh at Chelsea. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 308 - Season Preview

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) to cover the latest breaking transfer rumors. The group discusses whether Upamecano could come to Arsenal and what could possibly represent real value in the center back transfer market these days. There’s a brief discussion about Tierney and how his injury impacts the decision to sign him. Then the conversation turns to the Barca game and there’s a details analysis of several performances including AMN, Ozil, Chambers, Willock, Xhaka and quite a few others. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 307 - The Mullet Of Football Teams

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) to discuss Pepe’s arrival at Arsenal. After some ridiculous musical nonsense, the crew gets down to analyzing the Pepe signing from every angle. After that, there’s a discussion about the defense, takeaways from the Angers game, and a debate about whether additional business is in the offing. The pod ends with some excitement for the upcoming season and what comes next for the academy stars. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 306 - We Will Survive

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) to discuss the massive Pepe transfer news. They debate the importance of his signing, where and how he’ll play, and which players his arrival could impact the most. Then the discussion shifts to the game with Lyon. The group analyzes the performance of all the key players including Guendouzi, Xhaka, Nelson, Ceballos, Chambers and Mustafi. Unfortunately the podcast ends with a chat about the defence after listening to Unai Emery answer a question posed to him by our very own Tim. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 305 - Tempo Tempo Tempo

items.content:
On this jam-packed edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined first by Tim (@stillberto) (2:00-42:00) to discuss the Arsenal supporters Q&A with Raul, Vinai and Edu. They cover the tone, topics, messaging and critical information, as well as a general sense of the trio as a whole. After that, Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) join Elliot (42:00) to cover a wide range of topics. There’s a discussion of the bizarre and frightening attack on Ozil and Kolasinac, the Madrid game, the arrival of Arsenal’s two newest signings and some of the latest breaking Arsenal news. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 304 - Whatta Man

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s win over Fiorentina. There’s a discussion of the back three and Mustafi’s deterioration before the conversation turns upbeat and focuses on some excellent performances from the young players. Particular attention is paid to Saka, Nelson, Willock, Martinelli and of course, Eddie Nketiah. After breaking down the game, the conversation turns to transfers. There’s a brief discussion of the Ceballos loan move and then a long debate about Zaha and his value. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 303 - The Kids Are Alright

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) to discuss a busy week at Arsenal. First the group gives their opinion on the Saliba signing and specifically the loan back to St. Etienne. There’s also some brief discussion of other transfer rumors including Everton and Ceballos. Then the conversation turns to the fun preseason victory over Bayern in Los Angeles. Aubameyang gets praise, as well as young Joe Willock. There’s a debate about which young players could make their mark this season including Eddie Nketiah. At the end of the pod there’s a discussion about the fan protest against KSE ownership and Josh Kroenke’s response. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) to discuss a busy week at Arsenal. First the group gives their opinion on the Saliba signing and specifically the loan back to St. Etienne. There’s also some brief discussion of other transfer rumors including Everton and Ceballos. Then the conversation turns to the fun preseason victory over Bayern in Los Angeles. Aubameyang gets praise, as well as young Joe Willock. There’s a debate about which young players could make their mark this season including Eddie Nketiah. At the end of the pod there’s a discussion about the fan protest against KSE ownership and Josh Kroenke’s response. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 302 - Bigger Than Bayern

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Alex from Tiff Football (@TifoFootball_) to talk transfers! The show starts with an explanation of what Tifo Football does and what they’re trying to achieve with their Sensible Transfers videos. Alex then gives his opinion of the situation at Arsenal, the makeup of the squad and the decision to spend big money on two strikers. Then Elliot gets the details on specific players from Alex. They talk Saliba and a host of lesser-known young players before wrapping up the conversation with a discussion of the Tierney deal and what to expect from Guendouzi going forward. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@pozaninmypants) to celebrate the 300th episode of the podcast. Thanks to Arsenal being Arsenal, there’s plenty to discuss. Obviously the primary topic is the stunning falling out between the club and its captain, Laurent Koscielny. But after that’s covered, there’s still time to fret about youth players leaving, transfer business hopefully getting done, and players who sadly seem to be sticking around. After the break, Scott (@oh_that_crab) celebrates the 300th episode in style, by examining the statistics that show just what an uphill battle faces Arsenal in the upcoming season. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. 
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 300 - Oh Captain My Captain

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Diyar from the Back of The Nest Crystal Palace Podcast) @backofthenest to discuss all things Wilfried Zaha. Then Tim (@stillberto) makes his triumphant return along with Clive (@clivepafc) to talk US-England from the Women’s World Cup, transfer speculation, and an early take at what the top-4 race might look like this season. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 299 - Zahahahaha

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to wax poetic about the quite incredible Adidas kit launch video. After the appropriate love is given, attention turns back to transfers with a debate about the Zaha rumors in the wake of news that he’s pushing for a move to Arsenal. There’s some early panic about the lack of transfer activity and bit of speculation about Tierny arriving. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 298 - Clive’s On A Mad Ting

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) on a slow news day. The pod starts with a detailed discussion of Stan Kroenke’s ownership before shifting to players sales, Krystian Bielik and the challenge of the upcoming preseason tour. Then Elliot is Joined by Taylor Younani from Arsenal Los Angeles to discuss the upcoming pre-season stop in LA, describe supporting from all the way out on the west coast of the US, and preview some events planned for the preseason visit. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 297 - We Don't Stan

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) to cover some of the latest news ranging from the sacking of Burgess to the newspaper quotes from Bielik. Then the outrage turns to the fixtures and the shocking revelation that Arsenal will play every team twice and half of the games away. There’s a prediction about when the season could go well, and when it will inevitably go to pieces. Then, Elliot is Joined by Stats Bomb writer Mohamed (@moesquare) to discuss some possible transfer targets that you might not have heard of and a few that you definitely know. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) to cover some of the latest news ranging from the sacking of Burgess to the newspaper quotes from Bielik. Then the outrage turns to the fixtures and the shocking revelation that Arsenal will play every team twice and half of the games away. There’s a prediction about when the season could go well, and when it will inevitably go to pieces. Then, Elliot is Joined by Stats Bomb writer Mohamed (@moesquare) to discuss some possible transfer targets that you might not have heard of and a few that you definitely know. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 296 - Transfer Targets and Fixture Outrage

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Ted Knutson (@mixedknuts) founder and CEO of analytics and consulting firm, Stats Bomb. Ted covers a wide range of topics including his evaluation of the Emery appointment and his first season at the club, Arsenal’s current squad challenges, how data should be used to help the club build a better squad, current transfer rumors and potential transfer targets fo this summer. After the break, Clive (@clivepafc) joins the show to discuss the mood around Emery and look ahead to the work that has to be done this summer and discuss what kind of team Arsenal should be building. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 295 - Ted Talk

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to share commiserations over an embarrassing defeat in the Europa League Final. The group discusses specific tactical battles and player performances before looking at the bigger picture and what’s ahead for the club. There’s specific attention for Mesut Ozil, the wingbacks, Emery’s future and Stan’s ownership. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 294 - Europa League Final - Half Way There

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to preview the Europa League Final. There’s a discussion about lineups, matchups, tactics and then some predictions. Finally Clive covers the latest Emery comments and news from the wider world of football. Then Scott (@oh_that_crab) comes on to give the statistical look at the game and his personal predictions for the outcome. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 292 - May Mailbag

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to review Arsenal’s 2018/19 season despite the fact that there’s still a fairly important game to be played. There’s some summarizing at the beginning then the crew jumps straight into the awards. Categories include: best game, best goal, worst game, best player, most improved player, worst player, most disappointing player, and a grade for Emery. Clive and Paul are up first and Tim finishes it all off. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 291 - SEASON REVIEW - End Of Season Awards

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s win at Burnley on the final day of the Season. There’s a debate over the decision to start Aubameyang and the performance he put forward in chase of the Golden Boot, in addition to some genera reflection on his season overall. The group discusses Willock and Iwobi and the way Arsenal played with a midfield 3. Talk turns to the season as a whole including how it should be viewed and whether Arsenal are poised to take a step forward. There’s some additional season summary, a comparison with other top 4 clubs, and even a bit of transfer talk. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast. 
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 290 - Burnley (a) - Golden Boot Is A Trophy

items.content:
On this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s Europa League semifinal second leg victory at Valencia. The podcast starts with some concern over how the match started and the worry that another European comeback was on the cards. Then the conversation moves to the goal that got Arsenal level and the scintillating performance from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang. There’s also a debate about Ozil and the midfield and Arsenal’s inability to control a game with possession. After the break, the pod moves into celebration mode. There’s a look ahead to the final and what it all means for the club going forward. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 289 - Valencia (a) - We’ve Got Our Arsenal Baku

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s crushing, season ending draw to Brighton. The show starts with an inquest into the constantly changing lineups and why the team failed to press the advantage after going ahead 1-0. There’s a detailed analysis of the players who struggled and who takes the blame for their Equalizer. The subs are questioned and the run of form that lead to this moment is examined before the break. After the break, attention turns to Emery and the tenability of his position at the club with arguments made on both sides. There’s also an emotional farewell to Aaron Ramsey. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 288 - Brighton (h) - League Season Over

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s uplifting first leg victory over Valencia. After a very short discussion of a failed light show, the group discusses Arsenal’s slow start to the game, the first goal, and the decision to start Cech. Then things move on to the strikers, their immense performance, the missed chances, and the quality of the goals. There’s a debate about the midfield pairing and Arsenal’s pressing in the Europa League plus a discussion about the benefits and drawbacks of Kolasinac. Finally the group looks ahead to the second leg and the last two weeks of the league season. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 287 - Valencia (h) - A True Partnership

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by doom Dave (@mcmeiks) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss Arsenal’s massacre at Leicester. The conversation gets off to a rocky start with a debate about Emery’s future at the club. Then the debate gets more specific about the nature of the defeat at Leicester, the tactical plan and what specifically went wrong. Some specific performances are highlighted and there’s a wider debate about what has gone wrong over the past few weeks. Stan Kroenke’s role is explored as well. Then Aaron Ramsey’s departure from the club is discussed and his career is reviewed. After the break the group debates which players should stayed and which players should go, and the Europa League tie against Valencia is previewed. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 286 - Leicester (a) - Send Complaints To Dave

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, recorded live, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss Arsenal’s desperately poor loss as Wolves. The group discusses the impotent attack that begets the defensive issues. There are questions about individual attackers before the conversation turns to the head coach. Then there’s a question about how much the mentality impacts the performances and results. The podcast wraps up with a look ahead to Leicester and whether Arsenal are still in the top 4 race. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 285 - Wolves (a) - Slipping Away

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) and eventually Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s crushing home loss to Crystal Palace. Naturally the question of the lineup is raised and the group debates what options Emery had in light of suspensions and injuries. There’s a discussion of using a back four versus a back three. All three of Palace’s goals are analyzed through the lens of the specific defensive errors. There’s obviously a long discussion about Mustafi and there’s surprisingly one about Iwobi as well. Some of the good moments are broken down before the group looks ahead to Wolves and questions what this result means for top four. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 284 - Crystal Palace (h) - Imagine

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s comfortable win in Naples. The group discusses the lineup before a surprisingly comprehensive discussion about Ainsley Maitland-Niles. The talk turns to Lacazette’s goal and the overall play of the strikers. There’s praise for Koscielny and hang-wringing over Ramsey’s injury. The group looks ahead to the next round and wonders how Emery will rotate the team with so much football ahead. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

The group discusses the lineup before a surprisingly comprehensive discussion about Ainsley Maitland-Niles. The talk turns to Lacazette’s goal and the overall play of the strikers. There’s praise for Koscielny and hang-wringing over Ramsey’s injury. The group looks ahead to the next round and wonders how Emery will rotate the team with so much football ahead. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 283 - Napoli (a) - The Europa League In His Mind

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), and Andrew (@arseblog) to discuss Arsenal’s nervy but crucial win at Watford. There’s the usual stuff about lineups, a discussion of how the full-back selection impacted the attack and then a debate over the performance of Iwobi. After that the group covers Mkhitaryian’s disappointing evening, Mavropanos’ first team debut this season and the impact of the substitutions. There’s a final overview of the performance and discussion of Aubameyang’s display before the conversation turns to the second leg of the Napoli tie. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 282 - Watford (a) - Teenie Weenie Deeney

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s big performance and win over Napoli. After Elliot apologizes for being jetlagged, the group discusses the dominant midfield performance as well as the improvement in the wingbacks from the weekend. They discuss what went wrong with the strikers on the night and whether they have any concern about either of them. There’s an unexpected debate about Cech and praise for Koscielny plus a discussion of the substitutions and the way the game shifted in the second half. Towards the end of the episode there’s a look ahead to the second leg and Monday’s game. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 281 - Napoli (h) - Is It Just The Midfield

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s disappointing loss at Goodison Park. There’s a long debate about the quality of the team that Emery sent out and whether he had alternatives. Then the discussion turns to Arsenal’s away form and everyone does their best to explain it. The crew covers some of the major incidents in the match and the use of the subs and then worries over the upcoming ban for Mustafi. There’s a brief look ahead to Napoli and update on the Top 4 predictions as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 280 - Everton (a) - No Margin For Error

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s straightforward victory over Newcastle at the Emirates. After the usual discussion of the lineup and some absences, there’s analysis of performances from Ramsey, Lacazette, Ozil and Guendouzi. Clive discusses Emery’s changing philosophy and the group wonders what changed with Emery and Ramsey and Ozil. There’s some fun had at the expense of Spurs and United, plus a look forward to Everton. And Anthony Taylor gets his due of course. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 279 - Newcastle (h) - The Return Of The Status Quo

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) forces his panel to answer difficult “would you rather” questions that lead to some interesting insights. First up is Clive (@clivepafc) who delves into issues like whether he’d take top 4 or the Europa League trophy, which players he’d put in this team from previous years, who he’d sell, and what injuries he thinks we could tolerate. He wraps up his segment with a look at the performances of the academy players in Dubai. Then Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (oh_that_crab) come on and hash out issues like whether we need attackers or defenders, whether we can afford to sell Iwobi, Toreirra or Bellerin, whether we should rearrange our fixtures and play City and Liverpool again, and other equally sinister notions. It’s a fun way end a long interlull and we hope enjoy it! All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 278 - Would You Rather

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s rousing 3-0 victory over Rennes putting Arsenal into the Europa League quarterfinals. This is a packed episode that includes discussions of the lineup, the wingbacks, the strikers, Aaron Ramsey and the subs. After the group runs the rule of the performances and incidents, the discussion moves on to the Napoli draw and what we can expect for the remainder of the Europa League. items.title: Episode 277 - Rennes (h) - They Hold Our Dreams In Their Hands

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the magnificent 2-0 win over United at the Emirates. Of course there’s the usual discussion of the lineup and some individual performances. Then there’s a debate about who bossed the game and whether Leno should’ve been named man of the match. The group discusses the decision to give the penalty to Aubameyang and his style taking it. Then there’s a discussion of Emery’s performance in big games and whether Arsenal are now favorites for top 4. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 276 - United (h) - Pièce de Résistance

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the collapse of 10-man Arsenal at Rennes in the Europa League. They talk about the hot start and missed chances before diving into the red card, tactics after the sending off and who struggled the most in the wake of going down a man. Then the discussion shifts to United on Sunday and what to expect from that game. Later, Elliot is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) to get some general takeaways from the loss and mostly a look at how Arsenal can rescue the tie in the second leg. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 275 - Rennes (a) - Players Are Thick Sometimes

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s 1-1 draw at Wembley. They discuss basically everything. The lineups. The early missed chances. Ramsey’s goal. The missed calls. The Mustafi moment of madness. The penalty miss. But more than anything there’s just good old fashioned analysis of the performance, the aggressive tactics and substitutions, and the feeling that Emery certainly has the team moving in the right direction despite the disappointment of a draw in a game that Arsenal should’ve won. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 274 - Sp*rs (a) - It’s All On

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s 5-1 victory over Bournemouth. They discuss the major thematic conclusions from the match including how the back three can be used as an attacking formation. Individual performances are examined including Mkhitaryan, Ozil, Guendouzi and the lovely Carl Jenkinson. There’s some discussion of the goals, while the team is clicking and then a look ahead to the Spurs game. Tim gives his lineup prediction and expectation from a trip to Wembley. After the break, Clive (@clivepafc) comes on the show to discuss the progress Arsenal are making under emery. There’s formation and lineup talk and predictions for the derby as well. And there’s always time for laughing at Spurs too. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 273 - Bournemouth (h) - We’ve Got A Lot Of Talent Up Front

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s comfortable and at times stylish win over Southampton. There’s a discussion about the death of the back 3, the rotation policy, and the generally good play from the players on both wings. The group explores the good performances and how Southampton’s strategy might have played into Arsenal’s hands. Then there’s a brief discussion of how the second half played out and the impact of the subs, the expected rotation for the upcoming games, and whether Arsenal are now favorite for top 4. Of course there’s some laughing at rivals too. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

Of course there’s some laughing at rivals too. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 272 - Southampton (h) - The Platonic Ideal Of A Football Weekend

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s second leg victory over BATE Borisov. Of course we had to discuss the return of Mesut Ozil and his influence on the match. Then there’s the requisite discussion about why we struggle to defend fairly straightforward situations. A good chunk of the pod is dedicated to our stylistic approach in attack and whether getting it to the wings for crosses is really Arsenal’s identity now. There’s also a good debate about the striker situation in the wake of the announcement that Lacazette will miss both legs of the next round against Rennes. We discuss that draw, the upcoming Premier League fixtures and ask what a Denis Suarez does. Last but not least, there’s a brief chat about an Article from Jonathan Liew about the soul of the club. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 271 - BATE (h) - Something To Be A Bit Concerned About

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s ugly loss at BATE Borisov. Why a back 3? Will we win the tie now? Should Ozil be play? We answer all that plus question Emery’s choices. There’s debate over the style of play and why Arsenal lacked urgency chasing the game. There’s discussion of Lacazette’s red card and what it means for the return leg. The pod ends with a discussion about sacking managers and Mesut Ozil’s latest tweet (about an hour in). All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 270 - BATE (a) - I Don’t Know How I Feel About Emery

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s ugly win at Huddersfield. There’s a debate about whether the approach was defensive or the football was just poor. The group explores why Arsenal seemed unable to pass the football before discussing specific performances from Iwobi and Maitland-Niles and Mkhitaryan in particular. Then the group stops to have a laugh at Chelsea’s expense before asking why Sarri is being hounded out at Stamford Bridge while Arsenal fans are reluctant to direct too much frustration at Unai Emery. There’s a tiny bit on Mesut Ozil and the Europa League as well. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 269 - Huddersfield (a) - Wake Up Man!

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a dispiriting but not entirely unexpected loss at City. The pod starts with a debate over the starting lineup and formation and a question about whether the coach can succeed when his players make so many unforced errors. There’s some optimism as the discussion turns to the performances of Torreira and, especially Guendouzi. The group questions the thinking on some of the tactical decisions and the choice to use Denis Suarez in the second half. Then attention turns to the fixtures coming up and how Arsenal’s top four chances may start to look rosier in a month’s time. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 268 - City (a) - Is It Quality Or Is It System

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss the flurry of deadline day activity including Arsenal’s loan move for Denis Suarez and … that’s it. The group debates whether he will be a valuable contributor this season and where he will be deployed. After the break the discussion moves on to the Cardiff match. There’s concern about another conservative lineup and failure to create chances but also questions, as always, about the defending. Praise is given to Guendouzi and a bit for Mesut Ozil as well. Wrapping up, the trio discusses the goals, whether Emery needs to start picking just one striker, how to approach Man City away, and top four hopes. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 267 - Cardiff (h) - He’s A Big Big Big Unknown

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a dispiriting, injury-filled loss to United in the FA cup. The group debates Emery’s approach to this game and specifically the decision to play a 4231. There’s a discussion of AMN’s performance and whether he can be the RB going forward this season. The group discusses how arsenal will cope without any fit defenders and whether Petr Cech should just step aside now. There’s a debate about the Ozil situation and his cameo against United and questions asked about a very tired-looking performance in general. Section one wraps up with transfer talk. Then Elliot is joined by Dave from the @arse2mouse pod for a rambling trip to doomsville in the classing style of that pod. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a dispiriting, injury-filled loss to United in the FA cup. The group debates Emery’s approach to this game and specifically the decision to play a 4231. There’s a discussion of AMN’s performance and whether he can be the RB going forward this season. The group discusses how arsenal will cope without any fit defenders and whether Petr Cech should just step aside now. There’s a debate about the Ozil situation and his cameo against United and questions asked about a very tired-looking performance in general. Section one wraps up with transfer talk. Then Elliot is joined by Dave from the @arse2mouse pod for a rambling trip to doomsville in the classing style of that pod. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 266 - United (h) - Please Don’t Let Jesse Lingard Score

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss a crucial victory over Chelsea that stemmed a growing tide of frustration among the fans. The group debates Emery’s approach to this game and starts by dissecting Ramey’s role. Then the discussion moves to the performances of the strikers and maybe a bit about the reception for a former Arsenal striker now playing for Chelsea. There’s the question of whether Arsenal should always press as well. Then the group celebrates Koscielny and laments Bellerin’s injury. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 265 - Chelsea (h) - All That Matters Is Winning

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a disappointing loss and performance at West Ham that has inevitably lead to questions about the head coach and his vision for how he wants the team to play. There’s an early debate about the setup at West Ham and whether it was too defensive and an analysis of some individual performances. That conversation leads into a wider discussion about whether there has been progress this season. Additionally, the group examines whether Emery had been properly supported by the club and the extent to which he should get the funds he needs this window. The pod wraps up with a conversation about Mesut Ozil and how his relationship with Emery will need to be resolved for the team to move forward this season. All that and more on this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 264 - West Ham (a) - Filling In Gaps

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss whether Cesc Fabregas is an Arsenal legend (really). Then there’s a long debate about whether Arsenal should sign Denis Suarez. Finally there’s some football discussion and it’s focused on the performance of the kids at Blackpool and the next round tie against Manchester United. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 263 - Blackpool (a) - It’s A Style Thing

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss a much needed 4-1 win over Fulham at the Emirates. There’s a discussion about Arsenal’s continued struggles defending followed by a comprehensive debate about Alex Iwobi. After the break, the group discusses Lacazette, Aubameyang, and Xhaka’s performance. Lastly there’s a discussion of Aaron Ramsey’s impactful substitute appearance and his immediate future. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Scott (@oh_that_crab) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to say goodbye to 2018 by taking your questions in the wake of the loss at Anfield. The group discusses the Ozil issue, Ramsey’s future, Emery’s tactics, regression, rotation and what’s a reasonable goal for the season. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 261 - Liverpool (a) - 2018 Is Finally Over

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the draw at Brighton. They cover Aubameyang’s goal and miss, sterile possession, Guendouzi’s performance and of course, the substitutions. Scott (@oh_that_crab) drops in to give a brief statistical look at the match before descending into a litany of concerns about Emery’s recent approach. Then Clive returns to give final thoughts on the holiday period and what to expect at Anfield. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the draw at Brighton. They cover Aubameyang’s goal and miss, sterile possession, Guendouzi’s performance and of course, the substitutions. Scott (@oh_that_crab) drops in to give a brief statistical look at the match before descending into a litany of concerns about Emery’s recent approach. Then Clive returns to give final thoughts on the holiday period and what to expect at Anfield. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s Carabao Cup defeat at home to Spurs. The pod starts off addressing anti-semitic chants before getting into the Mesut Ozil situation. That debate extends for quite away before giving way to another long debate about squad rotation. There discussion of individual performances and what to expect in the weeks to come. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s seemingly annual Christmastime loss at Southampton. Topics include the lineup, the defending, Leno, Iwobi and Aubameyang. Then Scott (@oh_that_crab) gives the statistical numbers behind the performance. After the break there’s talk of Maitland-Niles, whether Emery is too conservative, and how to approach the upcoming League Cup North London Derby. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 257 - Southampton (a) - The Worst Christmas Tradition

items.content:
The Qarabag game wasn't exactly a classic. So instead of the usual post-match episode, we are giving you some content from the Patreon side. This is an episode of our special series called "In The Spotlight." In this episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner), Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc),Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) take an in-depth look at Mesut Ozil and Aaron Ramsey. They look at their Arsenal careers past, present and future. We hope you like it and regular service resumes after Southampton away! 
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 256 - In The Spotlight: Ramsey And Ozil

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss Arsenal’s victory over Huddersfield. The group starts with a discussion about racism in football. Then it’s on to the match with an analysis of the starting lineup. Did Emery get it wrong? The group discusses the rotational fouling and the dives as well as the halftime substitutions. There are question about Iwobi, whether Arsenal missed Ozil, a discussion of the striker situation, and praise for the all-powerful Lucas Torreira. Then there’s a very special competition! All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 255 - Huddersfield (h) - He’s Not Flamini Or Coquelin

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss Arsenal’s draw at Old Trafford. The group debates the use of the back three against a United side that didn’t come to play football but instead seemed focused on rotational fouling. Then there’s discussion of why Arsenal struggled to progress the ball and create sustained possession. After some criticism is directed at the referee, the group discusses Guendouzi, Ramsey, Iwobi and Aubameyang. Then they discuss the injuries, goals scored and allowed, the substitutions and whether Ozil was missed. Finally there’s a look ahead to the upcoming run of manageable fixtures. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 254 - Manchester United (a) - Project 13

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to celebrate Arsenal’s emphatic victory in the North London Derby. Tim gives his perspective on the atmosphere at the Emirates and the group discuses Emery’s decision to stick with a back 3. The group gives their take on performances from Aubameyang, Iwobi and Mkhitaryan and the halftime changes. There’s also a discussion about the fight and the impact that had on the game and Ramsey’s impact and what it means for his future. Scott (@oh_that_crab) stops by the give the statistical viewpoint and a quick look ahead to the trip to Old Trafford. Then Elliot, Tim, Paul and Clive discuss Torreira, Guendouzi, all the incidents from the match, and the what it means going forward. Finally there’s a debate about Mesut Ozil’s situation at the club and a quick look ahead to Wednesday’s game at United. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to praise the academy stars who helped Arsenal cruise past Vorskla in Kiev. There’s special attention paid to Smith Rowe, Willock and Nketia. Then the trio discusses the Aaron Ramsey situation and whether he should be utilized more in regular first team action. There’s further analysis of the match and a look ahead to the North London Derby at the weekend. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
On today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to run the rule over Arsenal’s 2-1 win at Bournemouth. There’s discussion of the surprise back 3, Aubameyang up front, the contrasting performances of the wide forwards, the substitutions, Mustafi giving us anxiety, and the impressiveness of the result. The podcast wraps up with a debate about Mesut Ozil being left out and how to set up for the trip to Ukraine on Thursday. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 251 - Bournemouth (a) - Found The Formation On The Internet

items.content:
On this very special 250th episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by a variety of exceptional guests. First up is Amy Lawrence (@amylawrence71) to discuss the growing interest in Arsenal around the world, the new management team at the club and her thoughts on Unai Emery. Then James (@gunnerblog) and Andrew (@arseblog) from the Arsecast Extra stop by. They discuss the prospects of a European Super League, Arsenal’s highs and lows this season, and what the club needs to do in January. Finally, Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) join Elliot to hand out some “third of season” awards. All that an more in this jam-packed 250th episode.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: 250th Episode Extravaganza!

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the disappointing draw at home to Wolves. Elliot does his usual moaning while the gang tries to determine where the match went wrong. There’s a debate over Xhaka’s performance, agreement about Kolasinac and questions about Arsenal’s two high-priced strikers. The pod examines whether Emery’s system has taken shape yet and how it might look moving forward. Then Scott (@oh_that_crab) stops by with the statistics underlying the performances. Finally, Clive and Paul find some silver linings. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the soporific nil-nil draw with Sporting and the injury to Danny Welbeck that overshadowed the game. The injury is discussed from a human aspect and footballing implication aspect. Then the group break down the performances of Ramsey, Guendouzi and Mkhitaryan. There’s a debate about how to rotate for the Europa League and the quality of the competition as a whole. Then there’s a brief look ahead to the weekend. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 248 - Sporting (h) - We Are With Him

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and a temporarily audio-challenged Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the breathless 1-1 draw between Arsenal and Liverpool at the Emirates. The group discusses virtually every player performance and key event in a match that served as the best performance yet under Unai Emery. Scott (@oh_that_crab) stops by to give a statistical analysis of the match. Then Tim and Clive return to continue the analysis. items.title: Episode 247 - Liverpool (h) - The Christening Of The Emery Era

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Tim (@stillberto) to discuss the quintessentially Carabao Cup tie between Arsenal and Blackpool at the Emirates. The group discusses some of the brighter performances and not-so-fantastic performances. There’s particular attention paid to Guendouzi, Smith Rowe and Maitland-Niles. Then the podcast is interrupted for a lengthy debate over Aaron Ramsey’s contract situation and how it has been handled by the player and the club. At this point, Elliot might go off the rails a little. The episode gets back on track with a quick analysis of Mustafi’s performance. Then there’s a discussion of the draw that pits Arsenal against Spurs at the Emirates and finally there’s a preview of the Liverpool match on Saturday. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 246 - Blackpool (h) - A Buffoon, A Lunatic, Unhinged

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss the slightly disappointing culmination of #Project24. There’s discussion of the full back crisis, why Mustafi keeps doing a Mustafi and what’s wrong with Arsenal’s build up play. Scott (@oh_that_crab) stops by with a quick look at the numbers behind the performance with a strong focus on Iwobi, Lacazette and Guendouzi. Then Elliot, Paul and Clive debate Emery’s substitutions and who should be Arsenal’s center forward for the upcoming Liverpool match. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 245 - Crystal Palace (a) - It’s A Game Of Inches

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss Arsenal’s victory at Sporting for their 11th consecutive win in all competitions. First there’s some debate over the use of first team players away in the Europa League. Then the group assess the causes of a sluggish first half performance with a focus on Ramsey, Elneny, Mkhitaryan and the full backs. There’s a section on Torreira and the way his involvement improved Guendouzi. There’s discussion of Aubameyang’s contribution and Danny Welbeck’s importance to the team. Lastly there’s a preview of the weekend’s match at Crystal Palace. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 244 - Sporting (a) - Getting My Retaliation In Early

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to gush over the performance of Mesut Ozil in Arsenal’s victory over Leicester. The crew debates the slow start to the match and wonders if the Emery system has finally taken clear shape. There’s praise for Torreira and questions about Lichsteiner. But mostly the crew praises a vintage performance from Ozil. Then Scott (@oh_that_crab) stops by briefly to break down the statistics from the victory. Finally, Clive, Paul and Elliot go deep on the second half goals and what this long winning run means for the club. Also there are some silly Paul jokes. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 243 - Leicester (h) - He’s Unai Emery’s Man

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to answer listener questions from across the world wide web. (is that thing still around?) There are questions about how we’ll fair in big games, the stats differences under Emery, much much more. Then Tim (@stillberto) stops by briefly to answer a question about Arsenal’s scouting or lack of scouting from Brazil. Finally, Clive (@clivepafc) comes on to answer questions about youth development, future Arsenal managers, formations and players he’d like to see at Arsenal. All that and plenty more in this “mailbag” edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 242 - October Mailbag

items.content:
On today’s “bonus international break” episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by special guest and Bundesliga expert Lewis Ambrose (@LGAmbrose) to discuss the players who have come to Arsenal from the Bundesliga. There’s plenty about Aubameyang and Mkhitaryan but also some discussion of Leno and Kolasinac. The pod ends with Lewis giving his thoughts on the situation with the German national team as it relates to Mesut Ozil.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 241 - Bonus Episode - Arsenal’s Bundesliga Round-Up

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s stunning 5-1 win over Fulham. There’s a discussion of the surprise selection and what to make of the formation. Then there’s praise for Lucas Torreira and how he’s starting to show what a special player he can be. The goals are discussed individually with special emphasis on that exceptional third goal from Ramsey. The group debates whether Iwobi and potentially Mkhitaryan have become indispensable players. Finally there’s a discussion of just how far this Arsenal team can go. Paul (@poznaninmypants) couldn’t make it on the main section of the pod but he stops by with a five minute rant to break up the monotony. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 240 - Fulham (a) - Playing What We See

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s win over Qarabag in the Europa League. There’s a discussion of the surprise back three and how it worked. Then there’s praise for Iwobi and Smith-Rowe on a very special night for the Hale End academy. The group debates the other players who shined (and struggled), with special focus on Guendouzi, Kolasinac, Holding and Leno. There’s mentions for the substitutes and a brief look ahead to Sunday’s trip to Fulham. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Scott (@oh_that_crab) to discuss Arsenal’s win over Watford. The group covers the continued struggles of key attacking players, the beginning of the Leno era in the Premier League, and the changes that changed the game. There’s there’s also a discussion of Rob Holding’s improving performances and Mustafi’s continued struggles. Towards the end, the group focuses on Iwobi and Danny Welbeck and what their introduction did to change the game. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 238 - Watford (h) - It’s All In The Game

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) to discuss Arsenal’s win over Brentford in the League Cup. The group covers which players shined and who struggled. There’s praise for Emile Smith-Rowe and Iwobi, plus questions about whether anyone made a case for more regular first team action. Then attentions turn to the news that Aaron Ramsey’s contract offer has been withdrawn. What does it mean for the club, the player, and what does it say about the way the club is run. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 237 - Brentford (h) - The Ramsey Hokey Pokey

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Paul (@poznaninmypants) and special guest Andrew (@arseblog) to discuss another win on the way to #Project24. Despite the 2-0 win over Everton there were some concerns about the performance and the group addresses them all, with a focus on the issues with Ozil an Ramsey, plus another debate over the strikers. Then Scott (Oh_that_crab) comes on to give us a statistical history of Lacazette and Aubameyang, plus some context on Ozil’s struggles. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Despite the 2-0 win over Everton there were some concerns about the performance and the group addresses them all, with a focus on the issues with Ozil an Ramsey, plus another debate over the strikers. Then Scott (Oh_that_crab) comes on to give us a statistical history of Lacazette and Aubameyang, plus some context on Ozil’s struggles. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 236 - Everton (h) - Outcome 2 Process 0

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss the finer points of pegging, and also Arsenal’s opening match of the Europa League. The crew debates the need for Iwobi and Mkhitaryan in the first team and whether Auba is the best option up front. There’s also predictions for the match at the weekend. Then Tim (@stillberto) stops by to describe the electric atmosphere at the Emirates, discuss his key takeaways from the match, and what he expects on Sunday. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by the host of The Breakdown from Arsenal.com, Adrian Clarke (@adrianjclarke) to get his perspective on what went wrong in the first half against Newcastle and what went right in the second half. There’s a particular focus on how to best use Mesut Ozil and Aaron Ramsey, plus praise for Lucas Torreira. Then Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) give their take on the match as #Project24 rolls on. There’s a brief look ahead to the start of our Europa League camp again and there might even be a mention of a certain chief executive who’s leaving for Milan. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 234 - Newcastle (a) - The Torreiracast

items.content:
In today’s episode of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by the managing editor of Stats Bomb and co-host of the Double Pivot podcast, Mike Goodman (@TheM_L_G) to get a neutral perspective on the top 4 race and some of the critical squad issues facing Arsenal at the moment. Then Clive (@clivepafc) and Tim (@stillberto) give their take on Emery’s first month in the Premier League and their view of the top 4 competition. There’s also a mini-preview of the Newcastle game and a good laugh at Jose Mourinho. All that and plenty more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 233 - Can Arsenal Finish In The Top 4

items.content:
In today's episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal's run-of-the-mill 3-2 away victory at Cardiff City. They debate the lineup, mull over Mesut Ozil and Aaron Ramsey's shifting roles, and Lucas Torreira's impact. Scott (@oh_that_crab) stops by to give the stats on the match. joins Clive to give his view of that game. Later, there's discussion of Lacazette and Aubameyang starting together, what to make of Granit Xhaka, and even praise for the center backs! Don't forget to give us a 5-star review and write nasty things in the comments!
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to discuss Arsenal’s 3-1 home victory over West Ham. There’s analysis of the lineup, the disjointed attack, openness at the back, halftime substitutions and whether Emery’s plan is coming together. There’s a heated debate about fan expectations. Finally, the group discusses the curious case of Mesut Ozil and his absence from the game. All that and more in an action-packed and emotionally-charged edition.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 231 - West Ham (h) - A Random Walk

items.content:
In this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Paul (@poznaninmypants) to preview the West Ham game, as Arsenal's quest for 24 points from the next 24 begins. They discuss the recently revealed player sprinting speeds, the manager's selection for the match, the return of Jack Wilshere, and whether the Aaron Ramsey contract situation could become a problem for the team. Then Scott (@oh_that_crab) stops by to provide a look at the stats to keep an eye on for the match. Finally, Paul and Elliot debate Ivan Gazidis' performance during his time at Arsenal and whether his departure would be a loss for the club. All that an more in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post (pre) Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
