items.title: Episode 230 - West Ham (h) Preview - Project 24 Begins

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, Elliot (@yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@stillberto), Clive (@clivepafc) and Paul (@poznaninmypants) to dissect Arsenal's frenetic 3-2 loss at Stamford Bridge. They discuss the interesting selection and open start to the game, how Arsenal fell behind, and the catalyst for Arsenal's resurgence before halftime plus the big chances that went begging. Scott (@oh_that_crab) gives the statistical look at the game, noting the start contrast between the halves. Then the Elliot, Tim, Clive and Paul discuss why the second half was such a disappointment before looking ahead to the next 8 games and wondering what can be learned from the first two. All that and more in this edition of the Arsenal Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 229 - Chelsea (a) - A Game Of Three Halves

items.content:
In today's episode, Elliot (@yankeegunner) discusses the Manchester City home defeat with Tim (@stillberto) and Paul (@poznaninmypants). Tim describes the atmosphere at the Emirates as the Emery era dawns. There's analysis of the lineup and formation, the attempts to play out from the back, and how to look at the result in context. Special attention is paid to Guendouzi, Ozil, Xhaka and Cech. Later, Clive (@clivepafc) gives his thoughts on the impact of the substitutes and whether they might be in line for a start at Chelsea. There's additional analysis of the performance and result and then some predictions for the match at Stamford Bridge. Elliot is joined by Oscar (@reunewal) for a 5 minutes teaser of his new article, coming soon to this Arsenal Vision Podcast website. Finally, Elliot announces the new "In the Spotlight" series coming to Patreon. All that and more, in this edition of the Arsenal Vision Post-Match Podcast!
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 227 - Season Preview

items.content:
In the wake of the news that Stan Kroenke was completing his buyout of the remaining shares of Arsenal Football Club, Elliot (@yankeegunner) went live to discuss the ramifications with mergers-and-acquisitions expert Matt (@giantgooner). Then Paul (@poznaninmypants) and Clive (@clivepafc) came on the show to give their feedback on the big announcement.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 226 - The Stanpocalypse - Live Show

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) answer your questions. There's talk of Calum Chambers' shock loan move to Fulham, the centre back situation, and what our midfield will be against Manchester City on Sunday. Scott (@Oh_That_Crab) answers his own question, and discusses the Gazidis situation. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Tim (@Stillberto) talk about Arsenal's pre season victory against Chelsea in Dublin. Ramsey's injury and the lack of a replacement for his skillset, Guendouzi's hype, justified or new player excitement? defensive worries (including full back), Aubameyang/Lacazette decision. items.title: Episode 223 - You say Guendouzi, I say Guendouzi

items.content:
Elliot (@Yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@Clivepafc) to discuss Mesut Ozil's problems back home, Alex Iwobi's new contract, Aaron Ramsey's contract situation and the Atletico Madrid game in Singapore. Scott (@Oh_that_crab) stops by to give a statistical analysis of Alex iwobi and Tim provides a sneak peak of his new book "Royal Arsenal - Champions of the South." It's all packed into this bumper addition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:encoded:
Elliot (@Yankeegunner) is joined by Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@Clivepafc) to discuss Mesut Ozil's problems back home, Alex Iwobi's new contract, Aaron Ramsey's contract situation and the Atletico Madrid game in Singapore. Scott (@Oh_that_crab) stops by to give a statistical analysis of Alex iwobi and Tim provides a sneak peak of his new book "Royal Arsenal - Champions of the South." It's all packed into this bumper addition of the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.


See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 222 - Not Gonna Go All Premature

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about Arsenal's first pre season game of the season against Borehamwood. Talk includes Emery's likely formation, how we may use Aubameyang and Lacazette. Who misses out when we have a full compliment of players; a quick look at our likely centre back partnership and more. Will Ivan Gazidis leave for Milan? All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner) and Scott (@Oh_That_crab) have a look at new Arsenal signing Lucas Torreira's numbers for Uruguay at the world cup and his former club Sampdoria. How will Unai Emery balance his midfield; Who starts at left-back? Jack Wilshere's departure; What shakes out of the Ronaldo move? All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (PoznanInMyPants) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about everyone's favourite topic, transfers! The team talk about Stephan Lichtsteiner and what he provides for the squad, Sokratis Papastathopoulos and what that means for the likes of Calum Chambers. Lucas Torreira's potentially imminent arrival and how much of a game changer that is for Arsenal. The need for a quick winger. This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 214 - Huddersfield (a) - Hair Apparent

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) are joined by guest Oscar (@Reunewal) The group discuss the 3-1 defeat at the hands of Leicester City at the King Power stadium. Alex Iwobi's performance in a V shaped midfield, the lack of resilience, Mavropanos making young mistakes, Clive makes Granit Xhaka our player of the season; a look ahead to a change of manager, how many players do we need? This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about Arsène Wenger's last game at the Emirates against Burnley in the Premier League. The reaction of the fans, Arsene's emotional speech, Henry missing, Mertesacker's importance going forward; Arsenal's attacking talent clicking into action, the Mesut Özil issue. This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the 2-1 defeat to Manchester United at Old Trafford. Discussion includes the impressive debut of Konstantinos Mavropanos. Ainley Maitland-Niles' man of the match midfield performance. Granit Xhaka's up and down, Ospina's need for cowboy boots; a look ahead to Thursday and whether or not Mkitaryan will start and make the difference. This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 210 - Manchester United (a) - Sh*t Yourself Senseless

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the 1-1 draw at home against Atletico Madrid in the 1st leg of the Europa League semi final. Discussions include Arsene's starting 11 and how they flew out of the blocks. Did Lacazette let himself down in front of goal or was he unlucky? Granit Xhaka's excellent performance in midfield, Danny Welbeck's transformation from a few weeks ago. Missed chances and of course, Laurent Koscielny's error to gift the away side a later equaliser. A look ahead to both Manchester United and the big 2nd leg in Spain. This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 208: West Ham (h) - Death Or Glory

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast: Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), Tim (@Stillberto) & Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the shock confirmation that Arsene Wenger will be calling it a day at the end of the season, we get a taste of Elliot's secret life as a boy band star, Arsene Wenger's best achivements, his worst moments, Ivan Gazidis and his role going forward. All this and plenty more in this weeks Arsenal Vision podcast

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto) and Scott (@Oh_That_Crab) talk about the excellent 4-1 victory in the quarter final first leg over CKSA Moscow at the Emirates stadium. The team discuss Arsene’s team selection, Arsenal’s improved attacking football, understanding Ramsey’s efficiency, Mesut Özil having the keys to this Arsenal team, what it means to lose Mkhitaryan, Jack Wilshere’s drop in form and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), @Stillberto and Clive (@ClivePAFC) take part in a full show to as Arsenal finally stick the sword into Stoke. Hopefully we do not have to see that terrible club again in the Premier League. The team discus the fans right not to turn up to games. Our awful first half, Lacazette’s return to the team, moving Aubameyang to the wing and Welbeck’s declining form. A look ahead to CSKA on Thursday night and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 201: Cherish Our Wide Men

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) discuss the 3-1 victory against AC Milan at the Emirates to send Arsenal through to the quarter finals of the Europa League. Discussion includes a good chuckle at Jose Mourinho’s meltdown, did Wilshere deserve his start?, Granit Xhaka’s improvement, lacking another scorer, Welbeck’s diving hysteria, Mkhitaryan’s promise, Tim takes a look at the Arsenal women and how this may be a turning point. This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.title: Episode 199: Watford (h) - The Villain Got His Comeuppance

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto) and Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) discuss the superb victory away in the San Siro against the giants A.C. Milan. Jack Wilshere’s form and position on the pitch, Ospina’s shaky moments, Mkhitaryan’s superb first half display, Is Ramsey Arsenal’s special sauce? Scott (@oh_that_crab) takes a look at the numbers while Clive (@ClivePAFC) gives his thoughts on the game. This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 198: A.C. Milan (a) - Ramsey's Special Sauce

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) are joined by Andrew (@arseblog) and they discuss the defeat at the hands of the mighty Brighton. They discuss Arsene’s team selection, why was Aaron Ramsey excluded from the squad, young players hitting a wall at Arsenal, looking ahead to Milan, Ivan Gazidis’ absence. Elliot also has a chat with  Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 197: Brighton (a) - Hitting Rock Bottom

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) returns alongside Elliot (@YankeeGunner) to discuss the 3-0 defeat at the hands of Manchester City. No, not that one, a different one. Discussions about the match, what is our strategy, should we be so far away from City? Scott (@oh_that_crab) looks at Mesut Özil’s disappointing night from a statistical point of view and our chances against Milan in the Europa league. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 196: Manchester City (h) - A Whole World Of Hurt

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Clive (@ClivePAFC) and Tim (@Stillberto) discuss the depressing cup final loss to Manchester City. What was Mustafi thinking? lack of service to Aubameyang, Is Calum Chambers ready for Arsenal? Jack Wilshere’s position in the team. Also discussed is Arsene Wenger’s future and why it’s time for a change. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) discuss the awful display against Östersunds at the Emirates. Discussion includes Arsenal’s mach preparation and instructions, Calum Chambers lack of form, Mkhitaryan’s wayward passing, an out of sorts Danny Welbeck, Ainsley Maitland-Niles being taken off at half time. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 194: Östersunds (h) - A Night To Forget

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) look briefly ahead to tonight’s (hopeful) dead rubber against Östersunds, who may start and who should be saved for Sunday. Talk about the upcoming cup final against Manchester City at Wembley. Discussion also includes talk on Hector Bellerin’s comments, Arsenal fandom and social media. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 193: Pre Östersunds (h) & Manchester City (n) Chat + Arsenal Fandom/Bellerin Stuff

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the routine 3-0 victory over Ostersunds in the Europa league. Ainsley Maitland-Niles gets his chance in centre midfield, Elliot has concerns over Danny Welbeck’s performance, Clive talks about the lack of partnerships on the pitch at Arsenal. What has happened to Sead Kolasianc? Scott (@oh_that_crab) looks at the XG numbers and the performances of certain players. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 192: Ostersunds (a) - The Dog & Duck On A Thursday Night

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the dire 1-0 defeat at that hands of Tottenham Hotspur at Wembley on Saturday afternoon. Discussion involves Arsene’s approach to the game, the execution of our counter attacks, lack of intensity, Lacazette’s lack of confidence, the idea of playing Lacazette and Aubameyang as a front two, where does our season go from here? This and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 191: Tottenham (a) - Out On Our Own

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the impressive 5-1 victory over tactical genius Sam Allardyce’s Everton at the Emirates Stadium. Discussion involves the fantastic home debut of Henrikh Mkhitaryan. What Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang gives us that Lacazette does not. Why it is a positive to have both strikers in the squad. Aaron Ramsey’s hat trick and why he has continued to polarise Arsenal fans' opinions. Scott (@oh_that_crab) dives into the numbers of the two new boys. We look ahead to the big clash against Tottenham. Should we keep four at the back or revert back to a back three? Listener questions and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 190: Everton (h) - The Mkhitaryan Show

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast we have a full house of Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the 3-1 defeat at the hands of struggling Swansea City in the Premier League. Granit Xhaka’s defensive limitations are discussed, is it time to replace him for an internal solution? Lacazette’s form and character is questioned, does the Frenchman face a spell on the substitutes bench? New addition Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is a big talking point. What will he provide the team that the team does not already have. Scott (@oh_that_crab) looks at Aubameyang's impressive numbers. Mesut Özil’s new contract and how we have to hope it’s not like Thierry Henry’s final Arsenal contract. Did Joachim Löw play a role in Özil’s contract? All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Tim (@Stillberto), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the 2-1 victory over Chelsea in the Carabao Cup. Tim has his say over the Alexis/Mkhitaryan swap. Discussion includes Granit Xhaka’s new midfield role, Elneny’s performance on the night. Clive talks about the switch to three at the back and how it impacted the team. More discussion on Alex Iwobi and his finishing technique. How do we process Arsene’s cup success? All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the loss of Alexis Sanchez, the arrival of Henrikh Mkhitaryan and what he can bring to Arsenal. The need for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and what his potential arrival means for Lacazette. Discussion also includes the 4-1 win over Crystal Palace. The excellence of Nacho Monreal and Laurent Koscielny, Granit Xhaka’s new midfield role and why Alex Iwobi has improved in recent weeks. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the 2-1 defeat against Bournemouth in the Premier League. Discussion includes Arsenal’s schoolboy defending, was Xhaka a bad buy? Should we have started Alexis? Wenger’s meaning of our ideal contract situation. They take a look at the current transfer rumours, Theo Walcott impending departure to Everton. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), & Tim (@Stillberto) talk about the 0-0 draw against Chelsea in the 1st leg of the Carabao Cup. Discussion includes Francis Coquelin’s departure to Valencia, Did Iwobi deserve his start? Elliot disagrees with Tim and Paul on our performance, Can Jack Wilshere and Ramsey play in the same team? Scott (@oh_that_crab) looks at which players can replace Alexis from a statistical point of view. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 185: Chelsea (a) - Shat & Stayed On The Pot

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), Clive (@ClivePAFC) & Tim (@Stillberto) talk about the 4-2 defeat against Nottingham Forest in the FA Cup. Discussion includes Arsene Wenger’s decision to play Mertesacker and Holding in a back four, the performances of the senior players on the day, the lack of experience on the bench, our approach compared to Liverpool, different views on Arsene Wenger’s comments on Sven Mislintat. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), Clive (@ClivePAFC) & Tim (@Stillberto) talk about the 2-2 draw against Chelsea at the Emirates. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), Tim (@Stillberto) & Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the 1-0 win against West Ham. Discussion includes Coquelin’s Pirlo performance, Tim’s excitement over long ball football, Paul talks about Willock’s head again, Maitland-Niles and how we set up against Liverpool on Friday night. Scott (@oh_that_crab) looks at our chances statistically on both the match on Friday and our chances at reaching the top four. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Clive (@ClivePAFC), Tim (@Stillberto) & Elliot (@YankeeGunner) talk about the crazy up and down 1-3 defeat at the hands of Manchester United at the Emirates on Saturday evening. Discussion includes the defensive errors, Mesut Õzil’s statistically world class performance, The Mustafi rumour, the pros and cons of Alexis Sanchez, Lacazette the real deal, the usual statistical break down from Scott (@oh_that_crab) All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), Clive (@ClivePAFC) & Tim (@Stillberto) talk about the late 1-0 victory against Burnley at Turd Moordoor. Discussion includes the performance of Alex Iwobi, how much we miss Mesut Ozil from a statistical point of view, polarising views of Alexis Sanchez, the rise of Mustafi. A look ahead to Huddersfield in midweek, will Arsene shake up his pack and if so where will that happen? The usual statistical break down from Scott (@oh_that_crab) All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

items.title: Episode 172: Burnley (a) - Yer Daaa

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the 1-0 defeat against Cologne or is it Koln? (Still unsure) in the Europa League. Discussion includes the performance and future of Ainsley Maitland-Niles, will Jack Wilshere ever get his groove back, did Oliver Giroud make a wrong decision to stay at Arsenal. The podders also have a look at Sven Mislintat and what aces he may already have up his sleeve. Also a look at Burnley tomorrow. We also get a statistical break down of the Cologne game and the upcoming trip to Turf Moor from @oh_that_crab. All this and plenty more in this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Clive (@ClivePAFC) and Tim (@Stillberto) talk about the dour 0-0 draw at home to Red Star Belgrade. The crew talk about the reasons why we couldn’t break them down, Francis Coquelin’s performance and where we go from here with him. The younger players like Joe Willock. Scott Willis‏ (@oh_that_crab) looks ahead to Manchester City from a statistical point of view while the podcast team rate our chances on Sunday. items.title: Episode 166: Norwich (h) - The Aristocrats

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the wonderful 5-2 victory away to Everton. talk includes the performance of Özil, Alexis and Lacazette playing for the first time together, the pros and cons of Aaron Ramsey, do we accept the limitations of playing Xhaka on his own in the middle of midfield? Can Jack Wilshere replace Granit Xhaka in midfield? This and much more all discussed on this week's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

Talk includes Arsène Wenger’s line up, the manager’s priorities, blowing up the squad, not addressing the midfield, Arsene’s legacy and much more all discussed on this weeks Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants), Tim (@Stillberto) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) talk about the Arsenal victory over Leicester City in the  first game of the Premier League season. This an much more all discussed on this weeks Arsenal Vision Pre Match Podcast.

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Clive (@ClivePAFC) all discuss the amazing 2-1 FA Cup final victory against Chelsea. The panel run through every member of the team and give ratings on their individual performance on the day. Arsene Wenger gets a mention also on what was an almost perfect day for him.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast: Elliot (@YankeeGunner), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Tim (@Stillberto) talk about the 1-0 victory against Tony Pulis’ West Brom at home in the Premier League. Elliot shares his concerns about Arsene turning back to Oliver Giroud while Paul and Tim reject such fears. The lack of starts for Lucas Perez brings about another Arsenal Vision Podcast bet, how many starts will the Spaniard get from now until the end of the season. All this and plenty more all discussed in this weeks Arsenal Vision podcast

items.title: Episode 49: Olympiacos (h) - Defensive Shambles Haunts Arsenal

items.content:
In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast: Goals Goals Goals rain down at Leicester City. Alexis scored his first Arsenal hat trick which we hope will now open his own personal floodgates. Walcott and Giroud continue to score one from the start and one off the bench. James (@GoonerFanatic49) returns and joins Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Elliot (@YankeeGunner) to discuss the fun and games, and also what awaits the team in the CL and then Manchester United next weekend.

See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

In today's Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast: Mike Dean is in dreamland once more as he steals the show with some of the worst refereeing you will likely to see this season. James (@GoonerFanatic49) reclaims his seat alongside Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Elliot (@YankeeGunner) to talk about what happened at Stamford Bridge as Arsenal were defeated by 2 goals to 0.

items.title: Episode 42: Liverpool (h) - Home Discomforts

items.content:
Arsenal bounced back with a 2-1 victory at Pardew's Palace thanks to goals from Oliver Giroud and Alexis Sanchez via some poor Crystal Palace players buggers leg. James (@GoonerFanatic49), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Elliot (@YankeeGunner) talk you through the improved Arsenal showing following last week's miserable showing

In the second part of the show, @YankeeGunner talks to @Stilberto about the season so far and expectations going forward.

See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

Arsenal bounced back with a 2-1 victory at Pardew's Palace thanks to goals from Oliver Giroud and Alexis Sanchez via some poor Crystal Palace players buggers leg. James (@GoonerFanatic49), Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) and Elliot (@YankeeGunner) talk you through the improved Arsenal showing following last week's miserable showing

In the second part of the show, @YankeeGunner talks to @Stilberto about the season so far and expectations going forward.

James (@Northbanklower ) and John (@Gooner_in_bcn) join the pod this week as James (@GoonerFanatic49) is away. But have no fear as Paul (@PoznanInMyPants) & Elliot (@YankeeGunner) are still here to make it all feel rather homely. The guys discuss Arsenal’s 1-0 victory at Burnley, Hector Bellerin, Szczesny’s future, Danny Welbeck and much more.

See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 16: Arsenal 2 Leicester City 1 - Gunners Cling On For 3 Points

items.content:
Not a good day at the office for Arsenal as nasty neighbours Tottenham take all three points at White Hart Lane. 
@YankeeGunner (Elliot),  
@PoznanInMyPants (Paul) and @GoonerFanatic49 (James) talk about what 
went wrong and where we go from here. Download the mp3 via this page, 
listen to it directly from Podbean or do your iTunes thing. All the 
options are below. You can also catch the podcast on YouTube on this 
page or check out the Arsenal Vision YouTube Page. 

See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 13: Brighton 2 Arsenal 3 / Gabriel & Bielik (Special Guest Arseblog)

items.content:
Arsenal will never beat a top side, Arsene will never win a trophy as Arsenal manager, Wenger will never win the league title [to be continued] 

Look
 at that score line, doesn’t it look amazing? Beating the Champions in 
their back garden is reserved for the best.. and Stoke City. James, 
Elliot and Paul go into the game in detail just after I ramble on about 
Santi Cazorla and his tick, tick, tick lil feet. Have a listen to the Arsenal Vision Post Match Podcast, it would be rude not to.
See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

items.title: Episode 12: Manchester City 0 Arsenal 2

items.content:
Arsenal thwack Stoke City right in the Shawcross and take all three points at the Emirates on Sunday afternoon. After some rambling words from myself, Elliot, Paul and James talk about Coq, Alexis (obviously) and Szczesny. So why waste time reading this and just get listening!

See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.
